original: ayaṃ nāmavavatthāpanapaññā. Yā rūpakkhandhassa vavatthāpane paññā, ayaṃ rūpavavatthāpanapaññāti
analyzed: ayam nāma vavatthāpana paññā yā rūpa kkhandhassa vavatthāpane paññā ayam rūpa vavatthāpana paññā ti
translated: understanding that defines the mental. The understanding that occurs in defining the material aggregate is understanding that defines the material.

original: evaṃ nāmarūpavavatthāpanavasena duvidhā.
analyzed: evam duvidhā
translated: So they are twofold as understanding that defines the mental and the material.

original: Catutthaduke dvīsu kāmāvacarakusalacittesu soḷasasu ca pañcakanayena catukkajjhānikesu
analyzed: catuttha duke dvīsu kāmāvacara kusala cittesu soḷasasu ca pañcaka nayena catukka jhānikesu
translated: In the fourth dyad, in the two kinds of sense-sphere profitable consciousness and in the sixteen kinds of jhāna consciousness of the fourfold and fivefold systems,

original: maggacittesu paññā somanassasahagatā. Dvīsu kāmāvacarakusalacittesu catūsu ca pañcamajjhānikesu
analyzed: magga cittesu paññā somanassa sahagatā dvīsu kāmāvacara kusala cittesu catūsu ca pañcamajjhānikesu
translated: understanding is accompanied by joy. In the two kinds of sense-sphere profitable consciousness and in the four kinds of jhāna consciousness of the fifth-jhāna triad,

original: maggacittesu paññā upekkhāsahagatāti evaṃ somanassupekkhāsahagatavasena duvidhā.
analyzed: magga cittesu paññā upekkhā sahagatā ti evam somanassa upekkhā sahagata vasena duvidhā
translated: understanding is accompanied by equanimity. So it is of two kinds as accompanied by joy and as accompanied by equanimity.

original: Pañcamaduke paṭhamamaggapaññā dassanabhūmi. Avasesamaggattayapaññā bhāvanābhūmīti evaṃ dassanabhāvanābhūmivasena duvidhā.
analyzed: pañcama duke paṭhama magga paññā dassana bhūmi avasesa magga ttaya paññā bhāvanā bhūmi iti evam dassana bhāvanā bhūmi vasena duvidhā
translated: In the fifth dyad, the understanding in the first path is the plane of seeing. The understanding in the remaining three paths is the plane of development. So it is of two kinds as the plane of seeing and the plane of development.

original: 427. Tikesu paṭhamattike parato assutvā paṭiladdhapaññā attano cintāvasena nipphannattā🔽cintāmayā. Parato sutvā paṭiladdhapaññā sutavasena nipphannattā sutamayā. Yathā tathā
analyzed: tikesu paṭhama ttike paratas a sutvā paṭiladdha paññā attano cintā vasena nipphanna ttā  cintā mayā paratas sutvā paṭiladdha paññā suta vasena nipphanna ttā suta mayā yathā tathā
translated: In the first of the triads, understanding that has been acquired without listening to it from another, being produced by one’s own thinking,

original: vā bhāvanāvasena nipphannā appanāppattā paññā bhāvanāmayā. Vuttañhetaṃ –
analyzed: vā bhāvanā vasena nipphannā appanā appattā paññā bhāvanā mayā vuttam ha etam
translated: is thinking-produced. That acquired by listening to it from another, being produced by what is heard, is what-is-heard-produced. That produced by development, whether or not it has reached absorption, is development-produced. This is said:

original: “Tattha katamā cintāmayā paññā? Yogavihitesu vā kammāyatanesu yogavihitesu vā sippāyatanesu
analyzed: tattha katamā cintā mayā paññā yoga vihitesu vā kamma āyatanesu yoga vihitesu vā sippa āyatanesu
translated: “Herein, what is understanding consisting in cogitation? In the case of the fields of action that are well proclaimed, or in the case of the fields of craft and skill that are well proclaimed,

original: yogavihitesu vā vijjāṭṭhānesu kammassakataṃ vā saccānulomikaṃ vā rūpaṃ aniccanti🔽vā vedanā…pe… saññā… saṅkhārā… viññāṇaṃ aniccanti vā, yaṃ evarūpiṃ anulomikaṃ khantiṃ
analyzed: yoga vihitesu vā vijjāṭṭhānesu kammassakatam vā sacca ānulomikam vā rūpam aniccanti  vā vedanā pe saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇam aniccanti vā yam evarūpim anulomikam khantim
translated: or in the case of the fields of science that are well proclaimed, either in the case of the self-dependence of a deed, or in the case of the conformity of the truths, or in the case of the conformity of materiality, that is to say, ‘Materiality is impermanent,’

original: diṭṭhiṃ ruciṃ mutiṃ pekkhaṃ dhammanijjhānakhantiṃ parato assutvā paṭilabhati, ayaṃ🔽vuccati cintāmayā paññā…pe… sutvā paṭilabhati, ayaṃ vuccati sutamayā paññā. Sabbāpi
analyzed: diṭṭhim rucim mutim pekkham dhamma nijjhāna khantim paratas a ssutvā paṭilabhati ayam  vuccati cintā mayā paññā ape sutvā paṭilabhati ayam vuccati suta mayā paññā sabbā api
translated: or in the case of the conformity of feeling, of perception, of formations, or of consciousness, that is to say, ‘Consciousness is impermanent,’ the acquiescence in conformity, the view in conformity, the preference in conformity, the approval in conformity, the inclination in conformity, the decision in conformity, the knowledge in conformity, that he acquires without hearing it from another,

original: samāpannassa paññā bhāvanāmayā paññā”ti.
analyzed: samāpannassa paññā bhāvanā mayā paññā ati
translated: is called understanding consisting in cogitation. … That he acquires by hearing it from another is called understanding consisting in what is heard. All understanding of one who is possessed of concentration is called understanding consisting in development. ”

original: Evaṃ cintāsutabhāvanāmayavasena tividhā.🔽Dutiyattike kāmāvacaradhamme ārabbha pavattā paññā parittārammaṇā. Rūpāvacarārūpāvacare
analyzed: evam cintā suta bhāvanā āmaya vasena tividhā  dutiya ttike kāmāvacara dhamme ārabbha pavattā paññā paritta ārammaṇā rūpāvacara arūpāvacare
translated: So it is of three kinds as consisting in cogitation, in what is heard, and in development.

original: ārabbha pavattā mahaggatārammaṇā. Sā lokiyavipassanā. Nibbānaṃ ārabbha pavattā appamāṇārammaṇā.
analyzed: ārabbha pavattā mahaggata ārammaṇā sā lokiya vipassanā nibbānam ārabbha pavattā appamāṇa ārammaṇā
translated: In the second triad understanding that occurs contingent upon states of the sense sphere is of a limited object. That contingent upon fine-material-sphere and immaterial-sphere states is of a great object. That is mundane insight. That contingent upon Nibbāna is of an infinite object.

original: Sā lokuttaravipassanāti evaṃ parittamahaggatāppamāṇārammaṇavasena tividhā.
analyzed: sā lokuttara vipassanā ti evam paritta mahaggata appamāṇa ārammaṇa vasena tividhā
translated: So it is of three kinds as a measureless object in the sense of being limited, great, and measureless.

original: Tatiyattike āyo nāma vuddhi, sā duvidhā anatthahānito atthuppattito ca. Tattha kosallaṃ āyakosallaṃ. Yathāha –🔽“Tattha katamaṃ āyakosallaṃ? Ime me dhamme manasikaroto anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā
analyzed: tatiya ttike āyaḥ nāma vuddhi sā duvidhā anattha hānitaḥ attha uppattitaḥ ca tattha kosallam āyakosallam yathā āha  tattha katamam āya kosallam ime me dhamme manasikarotaḥ anuppannā ca iva akusalāḥ dhammā
translated: In the third triad the “increase” is the growth; it is of two kinds as the disappearance of what is unprofitable and the appearance of what is profitable. Herein, skill in increase is that described thus:

original: na uppajjanti, uppannā ca akusalā dhammā pahīyanti, ime vā panime dhamme manasikaroto
analyzed: na uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā pahīyanti ime vā pan ime dhamme manasikaroto
translated: “Herein, what is skill in increase? When one who gives attention to these ideas finds that unprofit- able ideas do not arise in him, or that they arise in him and then disappear, or that he gives attention to other ideas,

original: anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti. Uppannā ca kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya🔽bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattantīti, yā tattha paññā pajānanā…pe… amoho dhammavicayo
analyzed: anuppannā ca iva kusalāḥ dhammāḥ uppajjanti uppannāḥ ca kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya  bhāvanāya pāripūriyā saṃvattanti iti yā tattha paññā amohaḥ dhammavicayo
translated: or that he finds that profitable ideas arise in him and then grow,

original: sammādiṭṭhi, idaṃ vuccati āyakosalla”nti.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi idam vuccati āyakosallam ti
translated: and reach growth, abundance and development, then the understanding of his doing so, the knowledge, the acquaintance, the clear-comprehension, the insight, the illumination is called skill in increase” .

original: Apāyoti pana avuddhi, sāpi duvidhā atthahānito ca anatthuppattito ca. Tattha kosallaṃ
analyzed: apāyaḥ ti pana avuddhi sā api duvidhā attha hānitaḥ ca anattha uppattitaḥ ca tattha kosallaṃ
translated: The “decrease” is the non-growth; it is of two kinds as the disappearance of what is profitable and the appearance of what is unprofitable. Herein, skill in decrease is that described thus:

original: apāyakosallaṃ. Yathāha “tattha katamaṃ apāyakosallaṃ? Ime dhamme manasikaroto anuppannā
analyzed: apāya kosallam yathā āha tattha katamam apāya kosallam ime dhamme manasikarotaḥ anuppannā
translated: is unskillfulness in the lower realms. As it is said: “What is unskillfulness in the lower realms? For one who attends inappropriately to these ideas,

original: ceva kusalā dhammā na uppajjantī”tiādi.🔽Sabbattha pana tesaṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ upāyesu nibbattikāraṇesu taṃkhaṇappavattaṃ ṭhānuppattikaṃ
analyzed: ca iva kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na uppajjanti itiādi  sabbattha pana tesam tesam dhammānam upāyesu nibbatti kāraṇesu tad khaṇa ppavattam ṭhānuppattikam
translated: And the unskilfulness about the lower kinds is that stated thus: “What is the unskilfulness about the lower kinds? It is this: when he gives his attention to these ideas, profitable ideas that have not arisen do not arise in him” , and so on.🔽But the skilfulness that occurs at the moment of the arising of the means in the various cases is called “skilfulness about means” .

original: kosallaṃ upāyakosallaṃ nāma. Yathāha – “sabbāpi tatrupāyā paññā upāyakosalla”nti.
analyzed: kosallam upāyakosallam nāma yathā āha sabbā api tatrupāyā paññā upāyakosallanti
translated: And that is stated thus: “Understanding of all the means is skilfulness about means” .

original: Evaṃ āyāpāyaupāyakosallavasena tividhā.
analyzed: evam āya apāya aupāya kosalla vasena tividhā
translated: So it is of three kinds as lower kinds, higher kinds, and means.

original: Catutthattike attano khandhe gahetvā āraddhā vipassanā paññā ajjhattābhinivesā. Parassa🔽khandhe bāhiraṃ vā anindriyabaddharūpaṃ gahetvā āraddhā bahiddhābhinivesā. Ubhayaṃ
analyzed: catuttha ttike attanaḥ khandhe gahetvā āraddhā vipassanā paññā ajjhatta abhinivesā parassa  khandhe bāhiram vā an indriya baddha rūpam gahetvā āraddhāḥ bahiddhā abhinivesāḥ ubhayam
translated: In the fourth tetrad, understanding that has been begun by taking one’s own aggregates is “insistence on the internal” .🔽That begun by taking another’s aggregates or external non-living-being matter is “insistence on the external” .

original: gahetvā āraddhā ajjhattabahiddhābhinivesāti evaṃ ajjhattābhinivesādivasena tividhā.
analyzed: gahetvā āraddhā ajjhatta bahiddha abhinivesā ati evam ajjhatta abhinivesa ādi vasena tividhā
translated: That begun by taking both is “insistence on the internal and the external” . So it is of three kinds as insistence on the internal, and so on.🔽In the first tetrad in the group of fours, the knowledge that occurs contingent upon the truth of suffering is “knowledge of suffering” .

original: 428. Catukkesu paṭhamacatukke dukkhasaccaṃ ārabbha pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ dukkhe ñāṇaṃ. Dukkhasamudayaṃ
analyzed: catukkesu paṭhama catukke dukkha saccam ārabbha pavattam ñāṇam dukkhe ñāṇam dukkha samudayam
translated: The knowledge that occurs contingent upon the origin of suffering is “knowledge of the origin” .

original: ārabbha pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ. Dukkhanirodhaṃ ārabbha pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ🔽dukkhanirodhe ñāṇaṃ. Dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ ārabbha pavattaṃ ñāṇaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminiyā
analyzed: ārabbha pavattam ñāṇam dukkha samudaye ñāṇam dukkha nirodham ārabbha pavattam ñāṇam  dukkha nirodhe ñāṇam dukkha nirodha gāminim paṭipadam ārabbha pavattam ñāṇam dukkha nirodha gāminiyā
translated: Knowledge that occurs in connection with the origin of suffering is🔽knowledge of the origin of suffering. Knowledge that occurs in connection with the cessation of suffering is🔽knowledge of the cessation of suffering. Knowledge that occurs in connection with the practice going to the cessation of suffering is🔽knowledge of the practice going to the cessation of suffering.

original: paṭipadāya ñāṇanti evaṃ catūsu saccesu ñāṇavasena catubbidhā.
analyzed: paṭipadāya ñāṇanti evam catūsu saccesu ñāṇa vasena catubbidhā
translated: Knowledge occurring in regard to the origin of suffering is knowledge of the origin of suffering. Knowledge occurring in regard to the cessation of suffering is knowledge of the cessation of suffering. Knowledge occurring in regard to the way leading to the cessation of suffering is knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of suffering. So it is fourfold as knowledge of the four truths.

original: Dutiyacatukke catasso paṭisambhidā nāma atthādīsu pabhedagatāni cattāri ñāṇāni. Vuttañhetaṃ🔽– “atthe ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā. Dhamme ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā. Tatradhammaniruttābhilāpe
analyzed: dutiya catukke catasso paṭisambhidāḥ nāma attha ādīsu pabheda gatāni cattāri ñāṇāni vuttam ha etam  atthe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dhamme ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā tatra dhamma nirutta abhilāpe
translated: In the second tetrad the four kinds of discrimination are the four kinds of knowledge that occur in the four instances beginning with meaning. For this is said:

original: ñāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidā. Ñāṇesu ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidā”ti.🔽Tattha atthoti saṅkhepato hetuphalassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Hetuphalaṃ hi yasmā hetuanusārena
analyzed: ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā ñāṇesu ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ati  tattha atthaḥ ti saṅkhepataḥ hetu phalassa itam adhivacanam hetu phalam hi yasmai hetu anusārena
translated: “Knowledge of meaning is discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of the law is discrimination of the law. Knowledge of the expression of that meaning and law in language is discrimination of language. Knowledge of knowledge is discrimination of perspicuity” .🔽Herein, meaning is in brief a name for cause and fruit. For because of the conformity of cause and fruit,🔽the fruit is obtained, is reached, is attained, thus it is called meaning . But in detail, whatever is a cause is a meaning,

original: ariyati adhigamiyati sampāpuṇiyati, tasmā atthoti vuccati. Pabhedato pana yaṃ kiñci
analyzed: tasmai attho ti vuccati pabhedato pana yam kiñci
translated: and whatever is a fruit is a meaning.

original: paccayasambhūtaṃ, nibbānaṃ, bhāsitattho, vipāko, kiriyāti ime pañca dhammā atthoti
analyzed: paccaya sambhūtam nibbānam bhāsita tthaḥ vipākaḥ kiriyā ati ime pañca dhammā attho ti
translated: Nibbāna, the meaning of what is said, result, and what is inoperative: these five ideas should be understood as the meaning.

original: veditabbā. Taṃ atthaṃ paccavekkhantassa tasmiṃ atthe pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: veditabbā tam attham paccavekkhantassa tasmin atthe pabheda gatam ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā
translated: When he reviews that meaning, his knowledge of the kinds of categories in that meaning is the discrimination of meaning.

original: Dhammotipi saṅkhepato paccayassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Paccayo hi yasmā taṃ taṃ dahati
analyzed: dhammaḥ tipi saṅkhepataḥ paccayassa etam adhivacanam paccayaḥ hi yasmā tam tam dahati
translated: As to the idea of idea: this is a word for condition in brief.

original: pavatteti vā sampāpuṇituṃ vā deti, tasmā dhammoti vuccati. Pabhedato pana yo koci
analyzed: pavattā iti vā sampāpuṇitum vā deti tasmā dhammo ti vuccati pabhedato pana yo koci
translated: For a condition is so called because it maintains , or because it occurs, or because it gives, in other words, because it causes to arrive.

original: phalanibbattako hetu, ariyamaggo, bhāsitaṃ, kusalaṃ, akusalanti ime pañca dhammā
analyzed: phala nibbattakaḥ hetu ariya maggaḥ bhāsitam kusalam akusalanti ime pañca dhammā
translated: But in detail any cause that generates a fruit, the noble path, what is said, profitable, unprofitable: these five ideas should be understood as the idea.

original: dhammoti veditabbā. Taṃ dhammaṃ paccavekkhantassa tasmiṃ dhamme pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: dhammaḥ ti veditabbā tam dhammam paccavekkhantassa tasmin dhamme pabheda gatam ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā
translated: When he reviews that idea, his knowledge of the kinds of categories in that idea is the discrimination of ideas.

original: Ayameva hi attho abhidhamme –
analyzed: ayam eva hi atthaḥ abhidhamme
translated: This is the meaning in the Further-Dhammas:

original: “Dukkhe ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā. Dukkhasamudaye ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā. Hetumhi
analyzed: dukkhe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā dukkha samudaye ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā hetumhi
translated: “Knowledge of suffering is the discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of the origin of suffering is the discrimination of ideas. Knowledge of the cessation of suffering is the discrimination of language. Knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of suffering is the discrimination of perspicuity.

original: ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā. Hetuphale ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā. Ye dhammā jātā bhūtā
analyzed: ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā hetu phale ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā ye dhammā jātā bhūtā
translated: Those ideas that have arisen, come to be,🔽been produced, been brought into play, manifested,

original: sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā. Imesu dhammesu ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā imesu dhammesu ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā
translated: knowledge of those ideas is the discrimination of meaning.

original: Yamhā dhammā te dhammā jātā bhūtā sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā, tesu dhammesu
analyzed: yamhā dhammā te dhammā jātā bhūtā sañjātā nibbattā abhinibbattā pātubhūtā tesu dhammesu
translated: Those ideas by which those ideas have arisen, come to be,

original: ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā. Jarāmaraṇe ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā. Jarāmaraṇasamudaye
analyzed: ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā jarā maraṇe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā jarā maraṇa samudaye
translated: been produced, been brought into play, manifested, knowledge of those ideas is the discrimination of ideas. Knowledge of ageing-and-death is the discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of the origin of ageing-and-death

original: ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā…pe… saṅkhāranirodhe ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā. Saṅkhāranirodhagāminiyā🔽paṭipadāya ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā. Idha bhikkhu dhammaṃ jānāti suttaṃ geyyaṃ…pe…
analyzed: ñāṇam saṅkhāra nirodhe ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā saṅkhāra nirodha gāminiyā  paṭipadāya ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā idha bhikkhu dhammam jānāti suttam geyyaṃ pe
translated: is the discrimination of ideas … Knowledge of the cessation of determinations is the discrimination of meaning. Knowledge of the way leading to the cessation of determinations🔽is the discrimination of ideas. Here a bhikkhu knows ideas, the Sutta, the verse,

original: vedallaṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati dhammapaṭisambhidā. So tassa tasseva bhāsitassa atthaṃ jānāti
analyzed: vedallam ayam vuccati dhamma paṭisambhidā so tassa tassa iva bhāsitassa attham jānāti
translated: the clarification of meaning, the up-to-date, the in-depth, the specific, and the expanded. This is called the discrimination of ideas. He knows the meaning of whatever is said thus:

original: ‘ayaṃ imassa bhāsitassa attho, ayaṃ imassa bhāsitassa attho’ti. Ayaṃ vuccati atthapaṭisambhidā.
analyzed: ayam imassa bhāsitassa attho ayam imassa bhāsitassa attho ti ayam vuccati attha paṭisambhidā
translated: ‘This is the meaning of that, this is the meaning of that’ . This is called the discrimination of meaning.

original: Katame dhammā kusalā? Yasmiṃ samaye kāmāvacaraṃ kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti…pe…
analyzed: katame dhammā kusalāḥ yasmin samaye kāmāvacaram kusalam cittam uppannam hoti pe
translated: What are the profitable ideas? When a profitable consciousness of the sense sphere has arisen …

original: ime dhammā kusalā. Imesu dhammesu ñāṇaṃ dhammapaṭisambhidā. Tesaṃ vipāke ñāṇaṃ atthapaṭisambhidā”tiādinā
analyzed: ime dhammā kusalāḥ imesu dhammesu ñāṇam dhamma paṭisambhidā tesam vipāke ñāṇam attha paṭisambhidā tiādinā
translated: these are profitable ideas. Knowledge of these ideas is the discrimination of ideas. Knowledge of their outcome is the discrimination of language” .

original: nayena vibhajitvā dassito.
analyzed: nayena vibhajitvā dassito
translated: and so on.

original: Tatradhammaniruttābhilāpe ñāṇanti tasmiṃ atthe ca dhamme ca yā sabhāvanirutti abyabhicārī
analyzed: tatra dhamma nirutta abhilāpe tasmin atthe ca dhamme ca yā abyabhicārī
translated: Herein, knowledge of the language of the ideas is the language that is the individual essence of the ideas and the meaning, which is invariable.

original: vohāro. Tadabhilāpe tassa bhāsane udīraṇe taṃ bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ udīritaṃ sutvāva ayaṃ
analyzed: vohāraḥ tad abhilāpe tassa bhāsane udīraṇe tam bhāsitam lapitam udīritam sutvā va ayam
translated: When that is spoken, uttered, proclaimed, he knows, after hearing it,

original: sabhāvanirutti, ayaṃ na sabhāvaniruttīti evaṃ tassā dhammaniruttisaññitāya sabhāvaniruttiyā
analyzed: sabhāva nirutti ayam na sabhāva nirutti iti evam tassā dhamma nirutti saññitāya sabhāva niruttiyā
translated: that this is the language of the individual essence called the language of the ideas,

original: māgadhikāya sabbasattānaṃ mūlabhāsāya pabhedagataṃ ñāṇaṃ niruttipaṭisambhidā. Niruttipaṭisambhidāppatto
analyzed: māgadhikāya sabba sattānam mūla bhāsāya pabheda gatam ñāṇam nirutti paṭisambhidā nirutti paṭisambhidā appatto
translated: and he knows the divisions of that language of the individual essence called the language of the ideas, which is the original language of all beings, namely, the Magadhan language. This is the discrimination of language.

original: hi phasso vedanāti evamādivacanaṃ sutvāva ayaṃ sabhāvaniruttīti jānāti. Phassā vedanoti
analyzed: hi phassaḥ vedanā iti evamādi vacanam sutvā ava ayam sa bhāva niruttī iti jānāti phassāḥ vedanā iti
translated: For one who has reached the discrimination of language knows, after hearing the words “Contact is feeling” , that this is the language of the individual essence.

original: evamādikaṃ pana ayaṃ na sabhāvaniruttīti.🔽Ñāṇesu ñāṇanti sabbattha ñāṇamārammaṇaṃ katvā paccavekkhantassa ñāṇārammaṇaṃ ñāṇaṃ,
analyzed: evamādikam pana ayam na  ñāṇesu ñāṇanti sabbattha ñāṇam ārammaṇam katvā paccavekkhantassa ñāṇa ārammaṇam ñāṇam
translated: But this is not the order of the words.🔽“Knowledge of the kinds of knowledge” is the knowledge that has as its object all the kinds of knowledge.

original: yathāvuttesu vā tesu ñāṇesu sagocarakiccādivasena vitthārato ñāṇaṃ paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāti attho.
analyzed: yathā vuttesu vā tesu ñāṇesu sagocara kicca ādi vasena vitthārataḥ ñāṇam paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ti attho
translated: Or the meaning is that the discrimination of perspicuity is the knowledge in detail of the kinds of knowledge stated in the way beginning, “Knowledge of the kinds of knowledge” by way of their respective spheres, functions, etc.

original: 429. Catassopi cetā paṭisambhidā dvīsu ṭhānesu pabhedaṃ gacchanti sekkhabhūmiyañca asekkhabhūmiyañca.
analyzed: catasso api cetā paṭisambhidā dvīsu ṭhānesu pabhedam gacchanti sekkha bhūmiyam ca asekkha bhūmiyam ca
translated: All these four discriminations are divided into two classes, namely, those of the learner’s plane and those of the adept’s plane.

original: Tattha aggasāvakānaṃ mahāsāvakānañca asekkhabhūmiyaṃ pabhedagatā. Ānandattheracittagahapatidhammikaupāsakaupāligahapatikhujjuttarāupāsikādīnaṃ🔽sekkhabhūmiyaṃ. Evaṃ dvīsu bhūmīsu pabhedaṃ gacchantiyopi cetā adhigamena pariyattiyā
analyzed: tattha aggasāvakānam mahāsāvakānam ca asekkha bhūmiyam pabheda gatāḥ ānanda ttheracitta gahapati dhammika aupāsaka aupāli gahapati khujjuttara upāsikā ādīnam  evam dvīsu bhūmīsu pabhedam gacchantiyā api cetāḥ adhigamena pariyattiyā
translated: Herein, those of the great disciples and chief disciples are on the adept’s plane. Those of the venerable Ānanda, the layman Citta, the layman Dhammapāla, the layman Upāli, the layman Kakudha, the laywoman Khujjuttarā, etc.,🔽are on the learner’s plane.🔽And although they are divided into these two classes, they are clear in five ways, namely, by discovery, by learning,

original: savanena paripucchāya pubbayogena cāti imehi pañcahākārehi visadā honti.
analyzed: savanena paripucchāya pubba yogena ca ati imehi pañcahākārehi visadāḥ honti
translated: by hearing, by questioning, and by previous practice.

original: Tattha adhigamo nāma arahattappatti. Pariyatti nāma buddhavacanassa pariyāpuṇanaṃ.🔽Savanaṃ nāma sakkaccaṃ atthiṃ katvā dhammassavanaṃ. Paripucchā nāma pāḷiaṭṭhakathādīsu
analyzed: tattha adhigamaḥ nāma arahatta patti pariyatti nāma buddha vacanassa pariyāpuṇanaṃ  savanam nāma sakkaccam atthim katvā dhammassavanam paripucchā nāma pāḷi aṭṭhakathā ādīsu
translated: Herein, attainment is the obtaining of Arahantship. Learning is the learning of the Buddha’s word.🔽Listening is listening to the Dhamma with eager ears. Questioning is the discussion of the text, the commentary, etc.,

original: gaṇṭhipadaatthapadavinicchayakathā, pubbayogo nāma pubbabuddhānaṃ sāsane gatapaccāgatikabhāvena
analyzed: gaṇṭhi pada attha pada vinicchaya kathā pubbayogaḥ nāma pubba buddhānam sāsane gatapaccāgatika bhāvena
translated: and the discussion of the meaning of the difficult terms, etc. Previous effort is the practice of insight that has gone as far as conformity knowledge, which is near to the change-of-lineage knowledge,

original: yāva anulomaṃ gotrabhusamīpaṃ, tāva vipassanānuyogo.
analyzed: anulomam gotrabhu samīpam tāva vipassanā anuyogaḥ
translated: in the dispensation of former Buddhas, with the difference that it has gone back and returned again.

original: Apare āhu –
analyzed: apare āhu
translated: Others say:🔽“Previous effort, much learning,

original: “Pubbayogo bāhusaccaṃ, desabhāsā ca āgamo;
analyzed: pubba yogaḥ bāhusaccam desa bhāsā ca āgamaḥ
translated: The language, the tradition,🔽Questioning, attainment,🔽And likewise dependence on a teacher,

original: Paripucchā adhigamo, garusannissayo tathā;
analyzed: paripucchā adhigamaḥ garu sannissayaḥ tathā
translated: And the possession of friends:

original: Mittasampatti cevāti, paṭisambhidapaccayā”ti.🔽Tattha pubbayogo vuttanayova. Bāhusaccaṃ nāma tesu tesu satthesu ca sippāyatanesu
analyzed: mitta sampatti ca iva ati paṭisambhida paccayā ati  tattha pubba yogaḥ vutta nayaḥ iva bāhusaccam nāma tesu tesu satthesu ca sippa āyatanesu
translated: These are the conditions for the analytic knowledges.”🔽Herein, previous effort is as already stated. Much learning is skill in the various crafts and in the various branches of science.

original: ca kusalatā. Desabhāsā nāma ekasatavohārakusalatā. Visesena pana māgadhike kosallaṃ.
analyzed: ca kusala tā desabhāsā nāma eka sata vohāra kusala tā visesena pana māgadhike kosallaṃ
translated: The language is skill in the hundred styles of writing. Skill in the Magadhan language is especially useful.

original: Āgamo nāma antamaso opammavaggamattassapi buddhavacanassa pariyāpuṇanaṃ. Paripucchā🔽nāma ekagāthāyapi atthavinicchayapucchanaṃ. Adhigamo nāma sotāpannatā vā…pe… arahattaṃ🔽vā. Garusannissayo nāma sutapaṭibhānabahulānaṃ garūnaṃ santike vāso. Mittasampatti🔽nāma tathārūpānaṃyeva mittānaṃ paṭilābhoti.🔽Tattha buddhā ca paccekabuddhā ca pubbayogañceva adhigamañca nissāya paṭisambhidā
analyzed: āgamaḥ nāma antamasaḥ opamma vagga mattassa api buddha vacanassa pariyāpuṇanam paripucchā  nāma attha vinicchaya pucchanam adhigamaḥ nāma sotāpanna tā vāpe arahattam  vā garu sannissayaḥ nāma suta paṭibhāna bahulānam garūnam santike vāsaḥ mitta sampatti  nāma mittānam  tattha buddhā ca paccekabuddhā ca pubba yogañca iva adhigamañca nissāya paṭisambhidā

original: pāpuṇanti. Sāvakā sabbānipi etāni kāraṇāni. Paṭisambhidāppattiyā ca pāṭiyekko kammaṭṭhānabhāvanānuyogo🔽nāma natthi. Sekkhānaṃ pana sekkhaphalavimokkhantikā. Asekkhānaṃ asekkhaphalavimokkhantikāva🔽paṭisambhidāppatti hoti. Tathāgatānaṃ hi dasabalāni viya ariyānaṃ ariyaphaleneva
analyzed: pāpuṇanti sāvakā sabbāni api etāni kāraṇāni paṭisambhidā appattiyā ca pāṭiyekkaḥ kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanā anuyogo 🔽nāma natthi sekkhānam pana sekkha phala vimokkha antikā asekkhānam asekkha phala vimokkha antikā ava 🔽paṭisambhidā appatti hoti tathāgatānam hi dasa balāni ariyānam ariya phalena iva

the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry … or of arahatship. ‘A good friend’ is one who is a good adviser and instructor. ‘Good companionship’ is the companionship of those who are like oneself.
