translated: Or it is a condition, in nine ways, as conascence, mutuality, support, association, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for the resultant consciousness that is rebirth-linking or for any other kind of resultant consciousness.

original: Vatthurūpassa paṭisandhiyaṃ sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākāhārindriyavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi🔽navadhā paccayo hoti. Ṭhapetvā pana vatthurūpaṃ sesarūpassa imesu navasu aññamaññapaccayaṃ
analyzed: vatthu rūpassa paṭisandhiyam sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra indriya vippayutta atthi avigata paccayehi  navadhā paccayaḥ hoti ṭhapetvā pana vatthu rūpam sesa rūpassa imesu navasu aññamañña paccayam
translated: It is a condition, in nine ways, as conascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for the materiality of the physical heart- basis at the moment of rebirth-linking.

original: apanetvā sesehi aṭṭhahi paccayehi paccayo hoti.🔽Abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇaṃ pana asaññasattarūpassa vā pañcavokārabhave vā kammajassa rūpassa
analyzed: apanetvā sesehi aṭṭhahi paccayehi paccayaḥ hoti  abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇam pana asañña satta rūpassa vā pañcavokāra bhave vā kamma jassa rūpassa
translated: But, leaving aside the materiality of the physical heart-basis, it is a condition, in eight ways, as the aforesaid conditions, omitting the mutuality condition, for the rest of materiality.

original: suttantikapariyāyato upanissayavasena ekadhāva paccayo hoti. Avasesaṃ paṭhamabhavaṅgato
analyzed: sutta ntika pariyāyataḥ upanissaya vasena ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti avasesam paṭhama bhavaṅgato
translated: But the consciousness that is kamma-result is a condition, in one way only, as decisive-support condition, for the materiality of beings in the non-percipient realm, and for the kamma-born materiality in the five-constituent becoming, according to the method stated in the “Description of the Aggregates” .

original: pabhuti sabbampi viññāṇaṃ tassa tassa nāmarūpassa yathārahaṃ paccayo hotīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: sabbam pi viññāṇam tassa tassa nāma rūpassa yathāraham paccayaḥ hoti iti veditabbam
translated: And the rest of consciousness, beginning with the first life-continuum after rebirth-linking, should be understood as a condition in the various ways appropriate to each for the various kinds of mentality-materiality.

original: Vitthārato pana tassa paccayanaye dassiyamāne sabbāpi paṭṭhānakathā vitthāretabbā
analyzed: vitthārato pana tassa paccaya naye dassiyamāne sabbā api paṭṭhānakathā vitthāretabbā
translated: But if the conditions for it are shown in detail, the whole of the Path of Purification would have to be written out.

original: hotīti na naṃ ārabhāma.
analyzed: na nam ārabhāma
translated: So we shall not embark on it.

original: Tattha siyā – kathaṃ panetaṃ jānitabbaṃ “paṭisandhināmarūpaṃ viññāṇapaccayā hotī”ti?🔽Suttato yuttito ca. Sutte hi “cittānuparivattino dhammā”tiādinā nayena bahudhā vedanādīnaṃ
analyzed: tattha siyā katham pana etam jānitabbam paṭisandhi nāma rūpam viññāṇa paccayā hoti iti  suttataḥ yuttitaḥ ca sutte hi citta anuparivattinaḥ dhammā ati ādinā nayena bahudhā vedanā ādīnam
translated: Here it may be asked: But how is it to be known that the rebirth-linking mentality-materiality is a condition for rebirth- linking consciousness?🔽From the Suttas and from reasoning. For in the Suttas the conditionality of feeling, perception, and formations by consciousness is established in many places in the way beginning, “States with parallel occurrence are those of consciousness and its concomitants” .

original: viññāṇapaccayatā siddhā. Yuttito pana,
analyzed: viññāṇa paccaya tā siddhā yuttitaḥ pana
translated: And from reasoning:🔽By what is seen here of the kind

original: Cittajena hi rūpena, idha diṭṭhena sijjhati;
analyzed: citta jena hi rūpena idha diṭṭhena sijjhati
translated: That matter is produced by mind,🔽It may be known that consciousness

original: Adiṭṭhassāpi rūpassa, viññāṇaṃ paccayo iti.
analyzed: a diṭṭhassa api rūpassa viññāṇam paccayaḥ iti
translated: Is matter’s condition too.

original: Citte hi pasanne appasanne vā tadanurūpāni rūpāni uppajjamānāni diṭṭhāni. Diṭṭhena🔽ca adiṭṭhassa anumānaṃ hotīti iminā idha diṭṭhena cittajarūpena adiṭṭhassāpi paṭisandhirūpassa
analyzed: citte hi pasanne appasanne vā tad anurūpāni rūpāni uppajjamānāni diṭṭhāni diṭṭhena  ca adiṭṭhassa anumānam hoti iti iminā idha diṭṭhena citta ja rūpena adiṭṭhassa api paṭisandhi rūpassa
translated: For when consciousness is glad or sad, matter arises accordingly. And what is seen here🔽may be taken as a reason for inferring that consciousness is a condition for the unseen matter of the rebirth-linking too.

original: viññāṇaṃ paccayo hotīti jānitabbametaṃ. Kammasamuṭṭhānassāpi hi tassa cittasamuṭṭhānasseva
analyzed: viññāṇam paccayaḥ hoti iti jānitabbam etam kamma samuṭṭhānassa api hi tassa citta samuṭṭhānassa iva
translated: For that is also a product of consciousness,

original: viññāṇapaccayatā paṭṭhāne āgatāti. Evaṃ paccayanayatopettha viññātabbo vinicchayoti.
analyzed: viññāṇa paccaya tā paṭṭhāne āgatā ati evam paccaya naya tā upa ittha viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ ti
translated: and the conditionality of consciousness is given in the Paṭṭhāna. This is how the exposition should be known here as to the method of condition.

original: Ayaṃ “viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpa”nti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.🔽Nāmarūpapaccayāsaḷāyatanapadavitthārakathā
analyzed: ayam viññāṇa paccayā nāma rūpan ti padasmim vitthāra kathā  nāma rūpa paccaya a saṅkha āyatana pada vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With consciousness as condition, mentality-materiality.”

original: 641. Nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatanapade –
analyzed: nāma rūpa paccayā saṅgāyatana pade
translated: As to the clause “With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base”:

original: Nāmaṃ khandhattayaṃ rūpaṃ, bhūtavatthādikaṃ mataṃ;
analyzed: rūpam matam
translated: Mentality is the three, and materiality Is called the primary elements, etc.;

original: Katekasesaṃ taṃ tassa, tādisasseva paccayo.
analyzed: kata ikasesam tam tassa tādisassa iva paccayo
translated: The rest is stated by ellipsis, and that Is a condition for what is similar to it.

original: Yañhetaṃ saḷāyatanasseva paccayabhūtaṃ nāmarūpaṃ, tattha nāmanti vedanādikkhandhattayaṃ,
analyzed: yat hetam saḷāyatanassa iva paccaya bhūtam nāma rūpam tattha nāmanti vedanā ādi kkhandha ttayam
translated: As to the mentality-materiality that is a condition for the sixfold base, here “mentality” is the three aggregates beginning with feeling.

original: rūpaṃ pana sasantatipariyāpannaṃ niyamato cattāri bhūtāni cha vatthūni jīvitindriyanti
analyzed: rūpam pana sa santati pariyāpannam niyamato cattāri bhūtāni cha vatthūni jīvitindriyanti
translated: And “materiality” is the four primary elements and the six physical bases, which are included in one’s own continuity, and the life faculty.🔽So it should be understood that “materiality” is called the primary elements, the physical bases, etc.

original: evaṃ bhūtavatthādikaṃ matanti veditabbaṃ. Taṃ pana nāmañca rūpañca nāmarūpañca nāmarūpanti
analyzed: evam bhūtavattha ādikam matanti veditabbam tam pana nāman ca rūpam ca nāma rūpam ca nāma rūpanti
translated: That is called “mentality-materiality” and also “name-and-form” and also “the sixfold base.”

original: evaṃ katekasesaṃ chaṭṭhāyatanañca saḷāyatanañca saḷāyatananti evaṃ katekasesasseva
analyzed: evam kata ikasesam chaṭṭha āyatanam ca saḷāyatanam ca saḷāyatanam evam kata ikasesassa iva
translated: The rest is stated by ellipsis, and that mentality-materiality is a condition for what is similar to it, namely, the sixfold base.

original: saḷāyatanassa paccayoti veditabbaṃ. Kasmā? Yasmā āruppe nāmameva paccayo, tañca chaṭṭhāyatanasseva
analyzed: paccayo ti veditabbam kasmai yasmai āruppe nāmam eva paccayaḥ tat ca chaṭṭha āyatanassa iva
translated: Why? Because in the immaterial sphere mentality alone is the condition, and that is only for the sixth base,

original: na aññassa. “Nāmapaccayā chaṭṭhāyatana”nti hi vibhaṅge vuttaṃ.
analyzed: na aññassa nāma paccayā chaṭṭha āyatanam ti hi vibhaṅge vuttam
translated: not for any other. For this is said in the Vibhaṅga: “With mentality as condition, the sixth base” .

original: Tattha siyā – kathaṃ panetaṃ jānitabbaṃ “nāmarūpaṃ saḷāyatanassa paccayo”ti? Nāmarūpabhāve🔽bhāvato. Tassa tassa hi nāmassa rūpassa ca bhāve taṃ taṃ āyatanaṃ hoti, na aññathā.
analyzed: tattha siyā katham pana itam jānitabbam nāma rūpam saḷāyatanassa paccayaḥ ti nāma rūpa bhāve  bhāvato tassa tassa hi nāmassa rūpassa ca bhāve tam tam āyatanam hoti na aññathā
translated: Here it may be asked: But how is it to be known that mentality-materiality is a condition for the sixfold base?🔽Because it exists when that exists.🔽For that base exists when that mentality and that materiality exist, not otherwise.

original: Sā panassa tabbhāvabhāvitā paccayanayasmiṃ yeva āvibhavissati. Tasmā,
analyzed: sā panassa tad bhāva bhāvitā paccaya nayasmim yā iva āvibhavissati tasmā
translated: And the fact that it is a condition in this way will be made clear in the section on the condition as cause.🔽So it should be understood🔽That which is a condition for what

original: Paṭisandhiyā pavatte vā, hoti yaṃ yassa paccayo;
analyzed: paṭisandhiyā pavatte vā hoti yam yassa paccayaḥ
translated: In rebirth-linking and in life-continuum,🔽And how it is a condition,

original: Yathā ca paccayo hoti, tathā neyyaṃ vibhāvinā.
analyzed: yathā ca paccayaḥ hoti tathā na iyyam vibhāvinā
translated: The wise should understand accordingly.🔽Here is an explanation of the meaning.

original: Tatrāyamatthadīpanā –🔽Nāmameva hi āruppe, paṭisandhipavattisu;
analyzed: tatra ayam attha dīpanā  nāmam eva hi āruppe paṭisandhi pavattisu
translated: In the immaterial sphere,🔽Mentality is a condition in seven ways and in six ways,

original: Paccayo sattadhā chadhā, hoti taṃ avakaṃsato.
analyzed: paccayaḥ sattadhā chadhā hoti tam avakaṃsato
translated: At most, for rebirth-linking and life-continuum.

original: Kathaṃ? Paṭisandhiyaṃ tāva avakaṃsato sahajātaaññamaññanissayasampayuttavipākaatthiavigatapaccayehi
analyzed: katham paṭisandhiyam tāva avakaṃsato sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta vipāka atthi avigata paccayehi
translated: How? Firstly, in rebirth-linking, they are related as conascent, etc., conditions, and as post-nascence, non-disappearance, and presence conditions.

original: sattadhā nāmaṃ chaṭṭhāyatanassa paccayo hoti. Kiñci panettha hetupaccayena, kiñci
analyzed: sattadhā nāmam chaṭṭha āyatanassa paccayaḥ hoti kiñci pana ittha hetu paccayena kiñci
translated: How? First of all, in rebirth-linking, the resultant mentality is a condition for the sixth, the mentality-materiality, in seven ways, that is to say, as conascence, mutuality, support, association, presence, non- disappearance, and root-cause conditions.🔽But it is a condition in other ways too, as kamma condition, etc.,

original: āhārapaccayenāti evaṃ aññathāpi paccayo hoti, tassa vasena ukkaṃsāvakaṃso veditabbo.🔽Pavattepi vipākaṃ vuttanayeneva paccayo hoti, itaraṃ pana avakaṃsato vuttappakāresu🔽paccayesu vipākapaccayavajjehi chahi paccayehi paccayo hoti. Kiñci panettha hetupaccayena,
analyzed: āhāra paccayena ati evam aññathā api paccayaḥ hoti tassa vasena ukkaṃsa avakaṃso veditabbo  pavatte api vipākam vutta nayena iva paccayaḥ hoti itaram pana avakaṃsataḥ vutta ppakāresu  paccayesu vipāka paccaya vajjehi chahi paccayehi paccayaḥ hoti kiñci pana ittha hetu paccayena
translated: and as nutriment condition. The maximum and minimum should be understood according to this method.

original: kiñci āhārapaccayenāti evaṃ aññathāpi paccayo hoti, tassa vasena ukkaṃsāvakaṃso veditabbo.
analyzed: kiñci āhāra paccayena ati evam aññathā api paccayaḥ hoti tassa vasena ukkaṃsa avakaṃsaḥ veditabbo
translated: In the course of an existence, the resultant mentality is a condition for the sixth, the mentality-materiality, in the same way. But the non-resultant mentality is a condition for the sixth, the mentality-materiality, in the six ways, that is to say, as the above seven conditions with the exception of kamma condition.

original: Aññasmimpi bhave nāmaṃ, tatheva paṭisandhiyaṃ;
analyzed: aññasmim pi bhave nāmam tathā iva
translated: But it is a condition in other ways too, as kamma condition,🔽and as nutriment condition. The maximum and minimum should be understood according to this method.🔽In rebirth-linking, mentality Is for the sixth in seven ways;

original: Chaṭṭhassa itaresaṃ taṃ, chahākārehi paccayo.
analyzed: chaṭṭhassa itaresam tam chahākārehi paccayaḥ
translated: For the rest, it is a condition In six ways, in other existences.

original: Āruppato hi aññasmimpi pañcavokārabhave taṃ vipākanāmaṃ hadayavatthuno sahāyaṃ hutvā
analyzed: āruppataḥ hi aññasmim pi pañcavokāra bhave tam vipāka nāmam hadaya vatthuno sahāyam hutvā
translated: For, apart from the immaterial sphere, in the other five-constituent becoming, that name-result is a companion of the heart-basis.

original: chaṭṭhassa manāyatanassa yathā āruppe vuttaṃ, tatheva avakaṃsato sattadhā paccayo
analyzed: chaṭṭhassa manāyatanassa yathā āruppe vuttam tathā iva avakaṃsato sattadhā paccayo
translated: For in the other five-constituent becoming, too, that called “resultant” is a condition in seven ways, as a prenascent, postnascent, and co-nascent condition, as a support, a dissociation, a disappearance, and a presence condition, for the heart-basis, acting as a companion to it,🔽just as in the immaterial becoming.

original: hoti. Itaresaṃ pana taṃ pañcannaṃ cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ catumahābhūtasahāyaṃ hutvā sahajātanissayavipākavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: hoti itaresam pana tam pañcannam cakkhāyatana ādīnam catu mahābhūta sahāyam hutvā sahajāta nissaya vipāka vippayutta atthi avigata vasena
translated: But for the other five beginning with the eye base, it is a condition in six ways, as a conascence, support, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance, and life-faculty condition, acting as a companion to the four great primaries.

original: chahākārehi paccayo hoti. Kiñci panettha hetupaccayena, kiñci āhārapaccayenāti evaṃ
analyzed: chahā ākārehi paccayaḥ hoti kiñci pana ittha hetu paccayena kiñci āhāra paccayena ati evam
translated: But in some instances it is a condition as a cause condition, and in some instances as a nutriment condition. So it is a condition

original: aññathāpi paccayo hoti, tassa vasena ukkaṃsāvakaṃso veditabbo.
analyzed: aññathā api paccayaḥ hoti tassa vasena ukkaṃsa avakaṃsaḥ veditabbo
translated: in other ways too. The excess and deficiency should be understood according to that.

original: Pavattepi tathā hoti, pākaṃ pākassa paccayo;
analyzed: pavatte pi tathā hoti pākam pākassa paccayaḥ
translated: In the course of an existence, too, the resultant is a condition🔽For the resultant in six ways;🔽The non-resultant is a condition

original: Apākaṃ avipākassa, chadhā chaṭṭhassa paccayo.
analyzed: apākam a vipākassa chadhā chaṭṭhassa paccayaḥ
translated: For the non-resultant in six ways.

original: Pavattepi hi pañcavokārabhave yathā paṭisandhiyaṃ, tatheva vipākanāmaṃ vipākassa
analyzed: pavatte api hi pañcavokāra bhave yathā paṭisandhiyam tathā iva vipāka nāmam vipākassa
translated: For in the five-constituent becoming in the course of an existence, too, that called “resultant” is a condition in six ways, as a prenascent, postnascent, and co-nascent condition, as a support, a dissociation, and a presence condition, for the resultant

original: chaṭṭhāyatanassa avakaṃsato sattadhā paccayo hoti. Avipākaṃ pana avipākassa chaṭṭhassa🔽avakaṃsatova tato vipākapaccayaṃ apanetvā chadhā paccayo hoti. Vuttanayeneva panettha
analyzed: chaṭṭha āyatanassa avakaṃsato sattadhā paccayaḥ hoti avipākam pana avipākassa chaṭṭhassa  avakaṃsataḥ iva tatas vipāka paccayam apanetvā chadhā paccayaḥ hoti vutta nayena iva pana ittha
translated: The sixfold base is a condition in seven ways as a prenascent condition for the six kinds of resultant consciousness. But the sixfold base is a condition in six ways as a prenascent condition for the six kinds of non-resultant consciousness,

original: ukkaṃsāvakaṃso veditabbo.
analyzed: ukkaṃsa avakaṃsaḥ veditabbo
translated: excluding the resultant condition. And here too the excess and deficiency should be understood in the way already stated.🔽And in the same way, too,

original: Tattheva sesapañcannaṃ, vipākaṃ paccayo bhave;
analyzed: tattha iva sesa pañcannam vipākam paccayaḥ bhave
translated: The rest are conditions for the five,🔽As resultant in the life-continuum;🔽And also non-resultant states,

original: Catudhā avipākampi, evameva pakāsitaṃ.🔽Tattheva hi pavatte sesānaṃ cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ cakkhupasādādivatthukaṃ itarampi
analyzed: catudhā evam eva pakāsitam  tattha iva hi pavatte sesānam cakkhāyatana ādīnam pañcannam cakkhu pasāda ādi vatthukam itaram pi
translated: Are shown as conditions in four ways.

original: vipākanāmaṃ pacchājātavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi catudhā paccayo hoti. Yathā🔽ca vipākaṃ, avipākampi evameva pakāsitaṃ. Tasmā kusalādibhedampi tesaṃ catudhā paccayo🔽hotīti veditabbaṃ. Evaṃ tāva nāmameva paṭisandhiyaṃ pavatte vā yassa yassa āyatanassa
analyzed: vipāka nāmam pacchājāta vippayutta atthi avigata paccayehi catudhā paccayaḥ hoti yathā  ca vipākam avipākam pi evam eva pakāsitam tasmā kusala ādi bhedam pi tesam catudhā paccayo  hoti iti veditabbam evam tāva nāmam eva paṭisandhiyam pavatte vā yassa yassa āyatanassa
translated: In the same life-continuum, the rest of the five beginning with the eye base are a condition in four ways, as postnascent, as dissociate, as prenascent, and as unprompted, for the eye-sensitivity-based resultant and for the other non-resultant states.

original: paccayo hoti, yathā ca paccayo hoti, tathā veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti yathā ca paccayaḥ hoti tathā veditabbam
translated: And just as the resultant states, so also the non-resultant states are shown as conditions in four ways. Therefore it should be understood that they are conditions in four ways for profitable and so on. This, in the first place, is how it should be understood as to the condition being that of any given base in rebirth-linking or in the course of an existence, and how it is a condition in each instance.

original: Rūpaṃ panettha āruppe, bhave bhavati paccayo;
analyzed: rūpam pana ittha āruppe bhave bhavati paccayaḥ
translated: Is a condition for existence.🔽But not for any single base,

original: Na ekāyatanassāpi, pañcakkhandhabhave pana.
analyzed: na eka āyatanassa api pañca kkhandha bhave pana
translated: But for the five aggregates’ existence.🔽In rebirth-linking, form is a condition,

original: Rūpato sandhiyaṃ vatthu, chadhā chaṭṭhassa paccayo;
analyzed: rūpataḥ sandhiyam vatthu chadhā chaṭṭhassa paccayaḥ
translated: In six ways, for the sixth base.🔽The four primary elements are

original: Bhūtāni catudhā honti, pañcannaṃ avisesato.
analyzed: bhūtāni catudhā honti pañcannam avisesataḥ
translated: Fourfold for the five, without distinction.

original: Rūpato hi paṭisandhiyaṃ vatthurūpaṃ chaṭṭhassa manāyatanassa sahajātaaññamaññanissayavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayehi🔽chadhā paccayo hoti. Cattāri pana bhūtāni avisesato paṭisandhiyaṃ pavatte ca yaṃ🔽yaṃ āyatanaṃ uppajjati, tassa tassa vasena pañcannampi cakkhāyatanādīnaṃ sahajātanissayaatthiavigatapaccayehi
analyzed: rūpataḥ hi paṭisandhiyam vatthu rūpam chaṭṭhassa mana āyatanassa sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vippayutta atthi avigata paccayehi  chadhā paccayaḥ hoti cattāri pana bhūtāni avisesataḥ paṭisandhiyam pavatte ca yam  yam āyatanam uppajjati tassa tassa vasena pañcannam pi cakkhāyatana ādīnam sahajāta nissaya atthi avigata paccayehi
translated: In rebirth-linking, the materiality of the physical heart- basis is a condition, in six ways, as conascence, mutuality, support, association, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for the sixth, the mind base.🔽But the four primary elements are, without distinction, a condition, in four ways, as conascence, support, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for the five beginning with the eye base,

original: catudhā paccayā honti.
analyzed: catudhā paccayāḥ honti
translated: in rebirth-linking and in the course of an existence, according as the base arises.🔽In three ways, life is their condition,

original: Tidhā jīvitametesaṃ, āhāro ca pavattiyaṃ;
analyzed: tidhā jīvitam etesam āhāro ca
translated: And nutriment in the course of an existence.🔽Those same are in six ways for the sixth,

original: Tāneva chadhā chaṭṭhassa, vatthu tasseva pañcadhā.
analyzed: tān eva chadhā chaṭṭhassa vatthu tassa iva pañcadhā
translated: And the heart-basis for that in five ways.

original: Etesaṃ pana cakkhādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ paṭisandhiyaṃ pavatte ca atthi avigataindriyavasena
analyzed: etesam pana cakkha ādīnam pañcannam paṭisandhiyam pavatte ca atthi avigata aindriya vasena
translated: In rebirth-linking and in the course of an existence, the five beginning with the eye are a condition, as presence and non-disappearance conditions, for the faculties,

original: rūpajīvitaṃ tidhā paccayo hoti. Āhāro ca atthiavigatāhāravasena tividhā paccayo hoti,
analyzed: rūpa jīvitam tidhā paccayaḥ hoti āhāro ca atthi avigata āhāra vasena tividhā paccayaḥ hoti
translated: And nutriment is a condition in four ways, as nutriment condition, as postnascence condition, as dissociation condition, and as absence condition.

original: so ca kho ye sattā āhārūpajīvino, tesaṃ āhārānugate kāye pavattiyaṃyeva, no paṭisandhiyaṃ.🔽Tāni pana pañca cakkhāyatanādīni chaṭṭhassa cakkhu sotaghānajivhākāyaviññāṇasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: ca kho ye sattāḥ āhāra upajīvino tesam āhāra anugate kāye  tāni pana pañca cakkhāyatana ādīni chaṭṭhassa cakkhu sota ghāna jivhā kāya viññāṇa saṅkhātassa
translated: And that is only in the occurrence of the material body that is accompanied by nutriment of those beings who are material and have nutriment for their life.

original: manāyatanassa nissayapurejātaindriyavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena chahākārehi paccayā🔽honti pavatte, no paṭisandhiyaṃ. Ṭhapetvā pana pañcaviññāṇāni tasseva avasesamanāyatanassa
analyzed: manāyatanassa nissaya purejāta aindriya vippayutta atthi avigata vasena chahā ākārehi paccayā  honti pavatte no paṭisandhiyam ṭhapetvā pana pañca viññāṇāni tassa iva avasesa manāyatanassa
translated: But the five beginning with the eye base are conditions in six ways, as support, as prenascence, as faculty, as dissociation, as absence, and as non-disappearance, for the sixth, that is, for the mind base called eye-, ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness.🔽They are conditions for that in occurrence, not in rebirth-linking.

original: vatthurūpaṃ nissayapurejātavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena pañcadhā paccayo hoti pavatteyeva,🔽no paṭisandhiyaṃ. Evaṃ rūpameva paṭisandhiyaṃ pavatte vā yassa yassa āyatanassa paccayo
analyzed: vatthu rūpam nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigata vasena pañcadhā paccayaḥ hoti pavatteya eva  no paṭisandhiyam evam rūpam eva paṭisandhiyam pavatte vā yassa yassa āyatanassa paccayo
translated: But the materiality of the physical heart- basis is a condition in five ways, as support, as prenascence, as dissociation, as absence, and as non-disappearance, for the remaining mind base,🔽which is called mind-consciousness element. It is a condition in occurrence, not in rebirth-linking.

original: hoti, yathā ca paccayo hoti, tathā veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: hoti yathā ca paccayaḥ hoti tathā veditabbam
translated: So it should be understood how materiality is a condition in whatever way for whatever base in rebirth-linking and in occurrence.

original: Nāmarūpaṃ panubhayaṃ, hoti yaṃ yassa paccayo;
analyzed: nāma rūpam panubhayam hoti yam yassa paccayo
translated: For what is appropriate to what,🔽And how it is, should be understood,

original: Yathā ca tampi sabbattha, viññātabbaṃ vibhāvinā.🔽Seyyathidaṃ. Paṭisandhiyaṃ tāva pañcavokārabhave khandhattayavatthurūpasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: yathā ca tam pi sabbattha viññātabbam vibhāvinā  tat iyyathidam pañca vokāra bhave khandha tta yavatthu rūpa saṅkhātam
translated: As stated, by one who discerns.🔽Name-and-form, that is to say, is a condition in various ways for the sixfold base in rebirth-linking in the five-constituent becoming, which is called “three aggregates, one part of the four aggregates called form, and consciousness.”

original: nāmarūpaṃ chaṭṭhāyatanassa sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākasampayuttavippayuttaatthiavigatapaccayādīhi
analyzed: nāma rūpam cha ṭṭha āyatanassa sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka sampayutta vippayutta atthi avigata paccaya ādīhi
translated: It is a condition by conascence, mutuality, support, association, presence, non-disappearance, root, and result causes, and so on.

original: paccayo hotīti. Idamettha mukhamattaṃ. Vuttanayānusārena pana sakkā sabbaṃ yojetunti
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti iti idam ettha mukha mattam vutta naya anusārena pana sakkā sabbam yojetun ti
translated: This is the mere heading here. But the rest can be construed in the way already stated.

original: na ettha vitthāro dassitoti.
analyzed: na ettha vitthāraḥ dassito ti
translated: So no detailed treatment is given here.

original: Ayaṃ “nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatana”nti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.🔽Saḷāyatanapaccayāphassapadavitthārakathā
analyzed: ayam nāma rūpa paccayā padasmim vitthāra kathā  saṅkhāra paccaya aphassa pada vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With mentality-materiality as condition, the sixfold base.🔽1.1. The sixfold base as condition for contact

original: 642. Saḷāyatanapaccayā phassapade –
analyzed: saḷāyatana paccayā phassa pade
translated: As regards the clause “With the sixfold base as condition, contact,”🔽There are six kinds of contact in brief,

original: Saḷeva phassā saṅkhepā, cakkhusamphassaādayo;
analyzed: phassā saṅkhepā cakkhu samphassa ādayo
translated: Eye-contact, etc., thirty-two,

original: Viññāṇamiva bāttiṃsa, vitthārena bhavanti te.
analyzed: viññāṇam iva vāttiṃsa vitthārena bhavanti te
translated: In detail, as in consciousness.

original: Saṅkhepena hi saḷāyatanapaccayā phassoti cakkhusamphasso, sotasamphasso, ghānasamphasso,
analyzed: saṅkhepena hi saḷāyatana paccayā phasso ti cakkhu samphassaḥ sota samphasso ghāna samphasso
translated: In brief, with the eye as condition there is eye-contact, with the ear as condition there is ear-contact, with the nose as condition there is nose-contact,

original: jivhāsamphasso, kāyasamphasso, manosamphassoti ime cakkhusamphassādayo cha eva phassā
analyzed: jivhā samphasso kāya samphasso manaḥ samphasso ti ime cakkhu samphassa ādayo cha eva phassā
translated: with the tongue as condition there is tongue-contact, with the body as condition there is body-contact, with the mind as condition there is mind-contact. These are the six kinds of contact,

original: bhavanti. Vitthārena pana cakkhusamphassādayo pañca kusalavipākā, pañca akusalavipākāti🔽dasa, sesā bāvīsati-lokiyavipākaviññāṇasampayuttā ca bāvīsatīti evaṃ sabbepi saṅkhārapaccayā
analyzed: bhavanti vitthārena pana cakkhu samphassa ādayo pañca kusala vipākā pañca akusala vipākā ati  dasa sesā bāvīsati lokiya vipāka viññāṇa sampayuttā ca bāvīsati iti evam sabbe pi saṅkhāra paccayā
translated: namely, eye-contact, etc., which are stated in the texts with the words: “With the sixfold base as condition, contact” . But in detail there are ten kinds of contact, namely, the five profitable resultant kinds and the five unprofitable resultant kinds,

original: vuttaviññāṇamiva bāttiṃsa honti.
analyzed: vutta viññāṇam iva bāttiṃsa honti
translated: which are stated with the words: “With the sixfold base as condition, contact” . There are another twenty-two kinds, namely, the profitable and unprofitable kinds associated with the twenty-two kinds of mundane resultant consciousness. So all these come to thirty-two kinds, like the consciousness stated with the words: “With formations as condition, consciousness” .

original: Yaṃ panetassa bāttiṃsavidhassāpi phassassa paccayo saḷāyatanaṃ, tattha,🔽Chaṭṭhena saha ajjhattaṃ, cakkhādiṃ bāhirehipi;
analyzed: yam pana itassa bāttiṃsavidhassa api phassassa paccayo saḷāyatanam tattha  chaṭṭhena saha ajjhattam cakkha ādim bāhirehi pi
translated: But the sixfold base that is a condition for this thirty-two-fold contact is stated in the texts with the words: “With the sixfold base as condition, contact” . Herein,🔽The wise affirm that in the world,🔽The sixfold base is with the sixth,🔽The six internal bases are with the sixth,🔽which is mind, and also with the six external ones,

original: Saḷāyatanamicchanti, chahi saddhiṃ vicakkhaṇā.
analyzed: saḷāyatanam icchanti chahi saddhim vicakkhaṇā
translated: the six bases external to the mind.

original: Tattha ye tāva “upādiṇṇakapavattikathā aya”nti sakasantatipariyāpannameva paccayaṃ
analyzed: tattha ye tāva upādiṇṇaka pavatti kathāḥ ayanti saka santati pariyāpannam eva paccayam
translated: Herein, those who say that this is a discussion of the kinds of becoming that occur in one’s own continuity

original: paccayuppannañca dīpenti, te “chaṭṭhāyatanapaccayā phasso”ti pāḷianusārato āruppe
analyzed: paccaya uppannañca dīpenti te chaṭṭha āyatana paccayā phasso ti pāḷi anusārato āruppe
translated: and they point out the condition as the sixfold base,

original: chaṭṭhāyatanañca, aññattha sabbasaṅgahato saḷāyatanañca phassassa paccayoti ekadesasarūpekasesaṃ🔽katvā chaṭṭhena saha ajjhattaṃ cakkhādiṃ saḷāyatananti icchanti. Tañhi chaṭṭhāyatanañca
analyzed: chaṭṭha āyatanam ca aññattha sabba saṅgahato saḷāyatanam ca phassassa paccayo ti eka desa sarūpa ikasesam  katvā chaṭṭhena saha ajjhattam cakkha ādim saḷāyatananti icchanti tat hi chaṭṭha āyatanañca
translated: and they point out the condition as the sixfold base together with the sixth base, taking the sixth base and the sixfold base as a single part with a remainder.

original: saḷāyatanañca saḷāyatanantveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
analyzed: saṅkham gacchati
translated: For that sixth base and that sixfold base are called the sixfold base.

original: Ye pana paccayuppannameva ekasantatipariyāpannaṃ dīpenti, paccayaṃ pana bhinnasantānampi,
analyzed: ye pana paccaya uppannam eva eka santati pariyāpannam dīpenti paccayam pana bhinna santānam pi
translated: But those who point out only the condition that is in the same continuity and who point out the condition that is in a different continuity as well,

original: te yaṃ yaṃ āyatanaṃ phassassa paccayo hoti, taṃ sabbampi dīpentā bāhirampi pariggahetvā🔽tadeva chaṭṭhena saha ajjhattaṃ bāhirehipi rūpāyatanādīhi saddhiṃ saḷāyatananti icchanti.
analyzed: te yam yam āyatanam phassassa paccayaḥ hoti tam sabbam pi dīpentā bāhiram pi pariggahetvā  tat eva chaṭṭhena saha ajjhattam bāhirehi pi rūpāyatana ādīhi saddhim icchanti
translated: pointing out all that is a condition for contact, taking even what is external,🔽they point out that same sixfold base together with the sixth base as the sixfold base, including what is internal and what is external.

original: Tampi hi chaṭṭhāyatanañca saḷāyatanañca saḷāyatananti etesaṃ ekasese kate saḷāyatanantveva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.
analyzed: tam pi hi chaṭṭha āyatanam ca saḷāyatanam ca etesam ekasese kate saḷāyatanam tu eva saṅkham gacchati
translated: For that sixth base and that sixfold base are called the sixfold base when they are taken as a single part with a remainder.

original: Etthāha – na sabbāyatanehi eko phasso sambhoti, nāpi ekamhā āyatanā sabbe phassā,
analyzed: ettha āha na sabba āyatanehi ekaḥ phasso na api ekamhā āyatanā sabbe phassā
translated: Here it may be asked: “But is it not a fact that one kind of contact does not originate from all the bases, nor all kinds of contact from one base?🔽And yet it is said ‘With the sixfold base as condition, contact’ . So how is that? ”

original: ayañca saḷāyatanapaccayā phassoti ekova vutto, so kasmāti. Tatridaṃ vissajjanaṃ –
analyzed: ayam ca saḷāyatana paccayā phasso ti ekaḥ iva vutto saḥ kasmā iti tatra idam vissajjanam
translated: The answer is this:

original: saccametaṃ, sabbehi eko, ekamhā vā sabbe na sambhonti, sambhoti pana anekehi eko.
analyzed: saccam etam sabbehi ekaḥ ekamhā vā sabbe na sambhonti sambhoti pana anekehi ekaḥ
translated: It is true that one kind of contact does not originate from all the bases, nor all kinds of contact from one base. But many kinds of contact originate from many bases.

original: Yathā cakkhusamphasso cakkhāyatanā rūpāyatanā cakkhuviññāṇasaṅkhātā manāyatanā avasesasampayuttadhammāyatanā
analyzed: yathā cakkhu samphasso cakkha āyatanā rūpa āyatanā cakkhu viññāṇa saṅkhātā manāyatanā avasesa sampayutta dhamma āyatanā
translated: For example, eye contact originates from the eye base, the visible-data base, and the consciousness base consisting of eye-consciousness, and from the remaining associated and co-existent states.

original: cāti evaṃ sabbattha yathānurūpaṃ yojetabbaṃ. Tasmā eva hi,🔽Ekopanekāyatanappabhavo iti dīpito;
analyzed: ca ati evam sabbattha yathānurūpam yojetabbam tasmai eva hi  iti dīpitaḥ
translated: And so in each instance. So it is said:🔽“From one or many bases, contact’s occurrence

original: Phassoyaṃ ekavacananiddesenīdha tādinā.
analyzed: ekavacana niddesena idha ta ādinā
translated: Is shown by the singular and plural.🔽”

original: Ekavacananiddesenāti saḷāyatanapaccayā phassoti iminā ekavacananiddesena anekehi āyatanehi eko phasso hotīti tādinā dīpitoti attho. Āyatanesu pana,🔽Chadhā pañca tato ekaṃ, navadhā bāhirāni cha;
analyzed: ekavacana niddesena ati saḷāyatana paccayā phassaḥ ti iminā ekavacana niddesena anekehi āyatanehi ekaḥ phassaḥ hoti iti ta ādinā dīpitaḥ ti atthaḥ āyatanesu pana 🔽chadhā pañca tatas ekam navadhā bāhirāni cha
translated: By the singular and plural: by the singular and plural in the words “With the sixfold base as condition, contact” . The meaning is that many kinds of contact originate from many bases.

original: Yathāsambhavametassa, paccayatte vibhāvaye.🔽Tatrāyaṃ vibhāvanā – cakkhāyatanādīni tāva pañca cakkhusamphassādibhedato pañcavidhassa
analyzed: yathāsambhavam etassa paccaya tte vibhāvaye  tatra ayam vibhāvanā cakkhu āyatana ādīni tāva pañca cakkhu samphassa ādi bhedato pañcavidhassa
translated: He should discern the conditionality of these, As is appropriate to each case.

original: phassassa nissayapurejātindriyavippayuttaatthiavigatavasena chadhā paccayā honti.
analyzed: phassassa nissaya purejāti indriya vippayutta atthi avigata vasena chadhā paccayāḥ honti
translated: Here is the discernment: the five bases beginning with the eye are conditions in six ways, as support, prenascence, faculty, dissociation, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for the five kinds of resultant contact classed as eye-contact, etc.

original: Tato paraṃ ekaṃ vipākamanāyatanaṃ anekabhedassa vipākamanosamphassassa sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākāhāraindriyasampayuttaatthiavigatavasena🔽navadhā paccayo hoti. Bāhiresu pana rūpāyatanaṃ cakkhusamphassassa ārammaṇapurejātaatthiavigatavasena
analyzed: tatas param ekam vipāka manāyatanam aneka bhedassa vipāka manaḥ samphassassa sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra aindriya sampayutta atthi avigata vasena  navadhā paccayaḥ hoti bāhiresu pana rūpa āyatanam cakkhu samphassassa ārammaṇa purejāta atthi avigata vasena
translated: Then the single resultant base consisting of mental data is a condition in nine ways, as conascence, mutuality, support, result, nutriment, faculty, association, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for the many kinds of resultant mental-data contact.🔽But the external bases consisting of visible data, etc., are conditions in four ways, as object, prenascence, presence, and non-disappearance conditions, for eye-contact, and so on.

original: catudhā paccayo hoti. Tathā saddāyatanādīni sotasamphassādīnaṃ. Manosamphassassa🔽pana tāni ca dhammāyatanañca tathā ca ārammaṇapaccayamatteneva cāti evaṃ bāhirāni
analyzed: catudhā paccayaḥ hoti tathā sadda āyatana ādīni sota samphassa ādīnam manaḥ samphassassa  pana tāni ca dhamma āyatanam ca tathā ca ārammaṇa paccaya mattena iva ca ati evam bāhirāni
translated: And the mental-data base is a condition in the same four ways for mind-contact.🔽So he should discern the conditionality of these external bases,

original: cha yathāsambhavametassa paccayatte vibhāvayeti.
analyzed: cha yathāsambhavam etassa paccaya tte vibhāvaya iti
translated: as is appropriate to each case, in the way just stated.

original: Ayaṃ “saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso”ti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.🔽Phassapaccayāvedanāpadavitthārakathā
analyzed: ayam saḷāyatana paccayā phasso ti padasmim vitthāra kathā  phassa paccayā vedanā pada vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With the sixfold base as condition, contact.”

original: 643. Phassapaccayā vedanāpade –
analyzed: phassa paccayāḥ vedanā pade
translated: As regards the clause “With contact as condition, feeling”:

original: Dvārato vedanā vuttā, cakkhusamphassajādikā;
analyzed: dvārataḥ vedanā vuttā cakkhu samphassa jā ādikā
translated: Feeling is said to be sixfold, born of eye contact, etc.;

original: Saḷeva tā pabhedena, ekūnanavutī matā.🔽Etassapi padassa vibhaṅge “cakkhusamphassajā vedanā. Sota… ghāna… jivhā… kāya… manosamphassajā
analyzed: tā pa bhedena ekūnanavutī matā  etassa api padassa vibhaṅge cakkhu samphassa jā vedanā sota ghāna jivhā kāya manaḥ samphassa jā
translated: It is reckoned as sixty-two, according to analysis,

original: vedanā”ti evaṃ dvārato saḷeva vedanā vuttā, tā pana pabhedena ekūnanavutiyā cittehi🔽sampayuttattā ekūnanavuti matā.
analyzed: vedanā ti evam dvārataḥ vedanā vuttā tā pana pabhedena ekūnanavutiyā cittehi  ekūnanavuti matā
translated: In the analysis of this clause in the Vibhaṅga, “Feeling born of eye contact, feeling born of ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact” are said to be the six kinds of feeling according to the doors. But they are reckoned as sixty-two because they are associated with the fifty-nine kinds of consciousness,🔽excluding the four kinds of path consciousness, and the three kinds of resultant consciousness .

original: Vedanāsu panetāsu, idha bāttiṃsa vedanā;
analyzed: vedanāsu panetāsu idha bāttiṃsa vedanā
translated: Of these feelings, thirty-two

original: Vipākacittayuttāva, adhippetāti bhāsitā.
analyzed: vipāka citta yuttā ava adhippetā iti bhāsitā
translated: Are said to be intended here, being associated with resultant consciousness.🔽In the five doors, contact is a condition

original: Aṭṭhadhā tattha pañcannaṃ, pañcadvāramhi paccayo;
analyzed: aṭṭhadhā tattha pañcannam pañca dvāramhi paccayo
translated: For five kinds in eight ways;🔽For the rest, contact is a condition in one way,

original: Sesānaṃ ekadhā phasso, manodvārepi so tathā.
analyzed: ekadhā phassaḥ manaḥ dvāre pi saḥ tathā
translated: In the mind door too, in the same way.

original: Tattha hi pañcadvāre cakkhupasādādivatthukānaṃ pañcannaṃ vedanānaṃ cakkhusamphassādiko
analyzed: tattha hi pañca dvāre cakkhu pasāda ādi vatthukānam pañcannam vedanānam cakkhu samphassa ādiko
translated: In the five doors, contact as a condition for the five kinds of feeling that have the eye faculty, etc., as their physical basis is a condition in eight ways, that is, as support, prenascence, faculty, dissociation, presence, non-disappearance, root, and nutriment condition.

original: phasso sahajātaaññamaññanissayavipākaāhārasampayuttaatthiavigatavasena aṭṭhadhā paccayo🔽hoti. Sesānaṃ pana ekekasmiṃ dvāre sampaṭicchanasantīraṇatadārammaṇavasena pavattānaṃ
analyzed: phassaḥ sahajāta aññamañña nissaya vipāka āhāra sampayutta atthi avigata vasena aṭṭhadhā paccayaḥ  hoti sesānam pana ekekasmim dvāre sampaṭicchana santīraṇa tad ārammaṇa vasena pavattānam
translated: Contact is a condition in eight ways, as conascence, mutuality, support, kamma-result, nutriment, faculty, dissociation, and presence conditions.

original: kāmāvacaravipākavedanānaṃ so cakkhusamphassādiko phasso upanissayavasena ekadhāva paccayo hoti.🔽Manodvārepi so tathāti manodvārepi hi tadārammaṇavasena pavattānaṃ kāmāvacaravipākavedanānaṃ
analyzed: kāmāvacara vipāka vedanānam so cakkhu samphassa ādikaḥ phassaḥ upanissaya vasena ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti  manaḥ dvāre pi saḥ tathā ti manaḥ dvāre pi hi tad ārammaṇa vasena pavattānam kāmāvacara vipāka vedanānam
translated: But as a decisive-support condition it is a condition in one way only for the resultant feelings occurring in the five doors in the cognitive series beginning with receiving.

original: so sahajātamanosamphassasaṅkhāto phasso tatheva aṭṭhadhā paccayo hoti, paṭisandhibhavaṅgacutivasena🔽pavattānaṃ tebhūmakavipākavedanānampi. Yā pana tā manodvāre tadārammaṇavasena pavattā🔽kāmāvacaravedanā, tāsaṃ manodvārāvajjanasampayutto manosamphasso upanissayavasena
analyzed: so sahajāta manaḥ samphassa saṅkhāto phasso tathā iva aṭṭhadhā paccayaḥ hoti paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti vasena  pavattānam tebhūmaka vipāka vedanānam pi yā pana tā manaḥ dvāre tad ārammaṇa vasena pavattā  kāmāvacara vedanā tāsam manaḥ dvāra āvajjana sampayuttaḥ manaḥ samphassaḥ upanissaya vasena
translated: So too in the mind door: in the mind door too, that same contact called mind-contact is a condition in eight ways for the resultant feelings occurring in the mind door in the cognitive series beginning with receiving.🔽It is a condition in one way for the resultant feelings of the three planes occurring as rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death.🔽But the resultant feeling of the sense sphere that occurs in the mind door in the cognitive series beginning with receiving is a condition in one way, as decisive-support condition,

original: ekadhāva paccayo hotīti.
analyzed: ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti iti
translated: for the contact called mind-contact that is associated with the receiving of the mind door.

original: Ayaṃ “phassapaccayā vedanā”ti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.🔽Vedanāpaccayātaṇhāpadavitthārakathā
analyzed: ayam phassa paccayā vedanā ti padasmim vitthāra kathā  vedanā paccaya a taṇhā pada vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With contact as condition, feeling.🔽With feeling as condition, craving.

original: 644. Vedanāpaccayā taṇhāpade –
analyzed: vedanā paccayā taṇhā pade
translated: With feeling as condition, craving is stated in the clause “With feeling as condition, craving” .🔽Craving is shown here

original: Rūpataṇhādibhedena, cha taṇhā idha dīpitā;
analyzed: rūpa taṇhā ādi bhedena cha taṇhā dīpitā
translated: As sixfold by division into craving for forms, etc.;

original: Ekekā tividhā tattha, pavattākārato matā.🔽Imasmiṃ hi pade seṭṭhiputto brāhmaṇaputtoti pitito nāmavasena putto viya “rūpataṇhā.
analyzed: ekekā tividhā tattha pavatta ākārataḥ matā  imasmin hi pade seṭṭhi putto brāhmaṇa putto ti pititaḥ nāma vasena putto viya rūpa taṇhā
translated: Each is threefold by way of the three kinds of becoming.

original: Sadda… gandha… rasa… phoṭṭhabba… dhammataṇhā”ti ārammaṇato nāmavasena vibhaṅge cha taṇhā dīpitā.
analyzed: sadda gandha rasa phoṭṭhabba dhamma taṇhā ati ārammaṇataḥ nāma vasena vibhaṅge cha taṇhā dīpitā
translated: In this clause, craving is shown in the Vibhaṅga as sixfold by way of the division of craving into craving for forms, craving for sounds, craving for odours, craving for tastes, craving for touches, and craving for mental objects, just as a son is shown by way of the division of the son into a son by the breast, a son by the rite, a son by the field, a son by the womb, a son by the foot, and a son by the inheritance .

original: Tāsu pana taṇhāsu ekekā taṇhā pavattiākārato kāmataṇhā, bhavataṇhā, vibhavataṇhāti🔽evaṃ tividhā matā. Rūpataṇhāyeva hi yadā cakkhussa āpāthamāgataṃ rūpārammaṇaṃ kāmassādavasena
analyzed: tāsu pana taṇhāsu ekekā taṇhā pavatti ākārataḥ kāma taṇhā bhava taṇhā vibhava taṇhā ati  evam tividhā matā rūpa taṇhāya iva hi yadā cakkhussa āpātham āgatam rūpa ārammaṇam kāma ssāda vasena
translated: But in these six kinds of craving each kind is considered threefold by way of the three kinds of becoming in which it occurs, as craving for sensual pleasures, craving for becoming, and craving for non-becoming.

original: assādayamānā pavattati, tadā kāmataṇhā nāma hoti. Yadā tadevārammaṇaṃ “dhuvaṃ sassata”nti
analyzed: assādayamānā pavattati tadā kāma taṇhā nāma hoti yadā tat eva ārammaṇam dhuvam
translated: For craving for forms, etc., when it occurs enjoying a visible-object, sound, odour, flavour, or tangible object as a sensual pleasure, is called “craving for sensual pleasures.” When it occurs misinterpreting that same object as permanent and lasting and assuming it to be eternal, it is called “craving for becoming.”

original: pavattāya sassatadiṭṭhiyā saddhiṃ pavattati, tadā bhavataṇhā nāma hoti. Sassatadiṭṭhisahagato🔽hi rāgo bhavataṇhāti vuccati. Yadā pana tadevārammaṇaṃ “ucchijjati vinassatī”ti pavattāya
analyzed: pavattāya sassata diṭṭhiyā saddhim pavattati tadā bhava taṇhā nāma hoti sassata diṭṭhi sahagataḥ  hi rāgaḥ bhava taṇhā ti vuccati yadā pana tat eva ārammaṇam ucchijjati vinassati iti pavattāya
translated: When it occurs together with the eternalist view, it is called craving for becoming.🔽For lust associated with the eternalist view is called craving for becoming.

original: ucchedadiṭṭhiyā saddhiṃ pavattati, tadā vibhavataṇhā nāma hoti. Ucchedadiṭṭhisahagato
analyzed: uccheda diṭṭhiyā saddhim pavattati tadā vibhava taṇhā nāma hoti uccheda diṭṭhi sahagataḥ
translated: But when it occurs together with the annihilationist view, which occurs thus, “He is annihilated, perishes, and does not exist after death,” it is called craving for non-becoming.

original: hi rāgo vibhavataṇhāti vuccati. Esa nayo saddataṇhādīsupīti. Etā aṭṭhārasa taṇhā honti.
analyzed: hi rāgaḥ vibhava taṇhā ti vuccati esa nayo sadda taṇhā ādīsu pi iti etāḥ aṭṭhārasa taṇhāḥ honti
translated: For lust associated with the annihilationist view is called craving for non-becoming. So too with the craving for sound, and so on. These are the eighteen kinds of craving.

original: Tā ajjhattarūpādīsu aṭṭhārasa, bahiddhā aṭṭhārasāti chattiṃsa. Iti atītā chattiṃsa,
analyzed: tāḥ ajjhatta rūpa ādīsu aṭṭhārasa bahiddhā aṭṭhārasa ati chattiṃsa iti atītā chattiṃsa
translated: There are eighteen kinds of craving in the case of each of the internal bases, making thirty-six. So there are thirty-six kinds of craving in the past,

original: anāgatā chattiṃsa, paccuppannā chattiṃsāti aṭṭhasataṃ taṇhā honti. Tā puna saṅkheppamāṇā
analyzed: anāgatā chattiṃsa paccuppannā chattiṃsa ati aṭṭhasatam taṇhāḥ honti tā puna saṅkheppamāṇā
translated: thirty-six in the future, and thirty-six in the present, which make one hundred and eight kinds of craving. But when these are abbreviated,

original: rūpādiārammaṇavasena cha, kāmataṇhādivasena vā tissova taṇhā hontīti veditabbā.
analyzed: rūpa ādi ārammaṇa vasena cha kāma taṇhā ādi vasena vā tissaḥ uva taṇhāḥ honti iti veditabbā
translated: they should be understood as being of only three kinds, according to whether they have visible data, etc., as their object or whether they are craving for sensual pleasure, and so on.

original: Yasmā panime sattā puttaṃ assādetvā putte mamattena dhātiyā viya rūpādiārammaṇavasena
analyzed: yasmā panime sattā puttam assādetvā putte mamattena dhātiyā viya rūpa ādi ārammaṇa vasena
translated: But since these beings delight in a son, they are like a wet-nurse for the object, visible data, and so on, through their affection for the son.

original: uppajjamānaṃ vedanaṃ assādetvā vedanāya mamattena rūpādiārammaṇadāyakānaṃ cittakāra-gandhabba-gandhika-sūda-tantavāyarasāyanavidhāyakavejjādīnaṃ
analyzed: uppajjamānam vedanam assādetvā vedanāya mamattena rūpa ādi ārammaṇa dāyakānam cittakāra gandhabba gandhika sūda tantavāya rasāyana vidhāyaka vejja ādīnam
translated: And when they are feeling pleasure, they are pleased with the feeling and they show great honour to painters, musicians, perfumers, cooks, weavers, distillers, physicians, etc., who provide them with the objects of form, etc., that condition the feeling.

original: mahāsakkāraṃ karonti. Tasmā sabbāpesā vedanāpaccayā taṇhā hotīti veditabbā.
analyzed: mahā sakkāram karonti tasmā sabbāpesā vedanā paccayā taṇhā hoti iti veditabbā
translated: So all feeling should be understood as a condition for craving in this way.

original: Yasmā cettha adhippetā, vipākasukhavedanā;🔽Ekāva ekadhāvesā, tasmā taṇhāya paccayo.
analyzed: yasmai ca ittha adhippetā vipāka sukha vedanā  tasmā taṇhāya paccayo
translated: But since it is only the pleasant feeling🔽That is intended here, it is only that🔽Which is a condition for craving in one way,🔽That is to say, as decisive-support condition.

original: Ekadhāti upanissayapaccayeneva paccayo hoti. Yasmā vā,
analyzed: ekadhā ti upanissaya paccayena iva paccayaḥ hoti yasmai vā
translated: Or alternatively,🔽The suffering one seeks for pleasure,

original: Dukkhī sukhaṃ patthayati, sukhī bhiyyopi icchati;
analyzed: dukkhī sukham patthayati sukhī bhiyyas api icchati
translated: And the happy one still craves for more,🔽But equanimity is peaceful,

original: Upekkhā pana santattā, sukhamicceva bhāsitā.
analyzed: upekkhā pana santattā sukham iccā iva bhāsitā
translated: So it is called “pleasure” too.🔽So all three kinds of feeling

original: Taṇhāya paccayā tasmā, honti tissopi vedanā;
analyzed: taṇhāya paccayā tasmā honti tissaḥ api vedanā
translated: Are a condition for craving too,🔽And thus the Great Sage said,

original: Vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, iti vuttā mahesinā.
analyzed: vedanā paccayā taṇhā iti vuttā mahesinā
translated: “With feeling as condition, craving.”🔽And since there is no underlying tendency

original: Vedanāpaccayā cāpi, yasmā nānusayaṃ vinā;
analyzed: vedanā paccayā ca api yasmai na anusayam vinā
translated: Without a condition of feeling,🔽It is not in the one who is concentrated,

original: Hoti tasmā na sā hoti, brāhmaṇassa vusīmatoti.
analyzed: hoti tasmā na sā hoti brāhmaṇassa
translated: As the brahmans say.

original: Ayaṃ “vedanāpaccayā taṇhā”ti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.
analyzed: ayam vedanā paccayā taṇhā ti padasmim vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With feeling as condition, craving.”

original: Taṇhāpaccayāupādānapadavitthārakathā
analyzed: taṇhā paccayā upādāna pada vitthāra kathā
translated: The explanation of the clause “With craving as condition,clinging” is as follows.

original: 645. Taṇhāpaccayā upādānapade –
analyzed: taṇhā paccayā upādāna pade
translated: With craving as condition, clinging:

original: Upādānāni cattāri, tāni atthavibhāgato;
analyzed: upādānāni cattāri tāni attha vibhāgato
translated: Clingings are four, and these are analyzed🔽As to meaning, as to brief and detailed exposition,

original: Dhammasaṅkhepavitthārā, kamato ca vibhāvaye.🔽Tatrāyaṃ vibhāvanā – kāmupādānaṃ, diṭṭhupādānaṃ, sīlabbatupādānaṃ, attavādupādānanti
analyzed: dhamma saṅkhepa vitthārā kamataḥ ca vibhāvaye  tatra ayam vibhāvanā kāma upādānam diṭṭha upādānam sīla bbata upādānam atta vāda upādānam iti
translated: And as to how they are to be known.🔽Herein, as to meaning: there are these four kinds of clinging, that is to say, sense-desire clinging, clinging to views, clinging to rules and vows, and clinging to a doctrine of self.

original: imāni tāvettha cattāri upādānāni. Tesaṃ ayaṃ atthavibhāgo – vatthusaṅkhātaṃ kāmaṃ
analyzed: imāni tāva ettha cattāri upādānāni tesam ayam attha vibhāgaḥ vatthu saṅkhātam kāmam
translated: Their analysis as to meaning is as follows. Sense desires are what are called sense desires.

original: upādiyatīti kāmupādānaṃ, kāmo ca so upādānañcātipi kāmupādānaṃ. Upādānanti daḷhaggahaṇaṃ.
analyzed: upādiyati iti kāma upādānam kāmo ca saḥ upādānam ca atipi kāma upādānam upādānam ti daḷha ggahaṇam
translated: They are clung to , thus they are sense-desire clinging . Or sense desires are sense-desire clinging. Clinging is firm grasping.

original: Daḷhattho hettha upasaddo upāyāsaupakaṭṭhādīsu viya. Tathā diṭṭhi ca sā upādānañcāti
analyzed: daḷha atthaḥ ha ittha upasaddo upāyāsa aupakaṭṭha ādīsu viya tathā diṭṭhi ca sā upādānam ca ati
translated: The prefix upa in the sense of firm is like the upa in such words as upāyāsa and upākaṭṭha . Likewise, views are what are called views.

original: diṭṭhupādānaṃ. Diṭṭhiṃ upādiyatīti vā diṭṭhupādānaṃ. “Sassato attā ca loko cā”tiādīsu
analyzed: diṭṭhupādānam diṭṭhim upādiyati iti vā diṭṭhupādānam sassataḥ attā ca loko ca ati ādīsu
translated: They are clung to , thus they are clinging to views . Or views are clinging to views. For in such views as “The world and self are eternal”

original: hi purimadiṭṭhiṃ uttaradiṭṭhi upādiyati. Tathā sīlabbataṃ upādiyatīti sīlabbatupādānaṃ.
analyzed: hi purima diṭṭhim uttara diṭṭhi upādiyati tathā sīlabbatam upādiyati iti sīlabbata upādānam
translated: the later views cling to the earlier ones. Likewise, rules and vows are what are called rules and vows.🔽They are clung to , thus they are clinging to rules and vows .

original: Sīlabbatañca taṃ upādānañcātipi sīlabbatupādānaṃ. Gosīlagovatādīni hi “evaṃ suddhī”ti
analyzed: sīlabbatam ca tam upādānam ca atipi sīlabbata upādānam gosīla govata ādīni hi evam suddhi iti
translated: And virtue and duty are clinging too, thus virtue-and-duty clinging. For the cow-duty, the dog-duty, the jackal-duty, etc., are clingings since they are clung to by the people who adhere to them as purity.

original: abhinivesato sayameva upādānāni. Tathā vadanti etenāti vādo. Upādiyanti etenāti upādānaṃ.
analyzed: abhinivesataḥ sayam eva upādānāni tathā vadanti etena ati vādaḥ upādiyanti etena ati upādānam
translated: They speak thus, thus it is a view. They cling by means of this, thus it is clinging.

original: Kiṃ vadanti, upādiyanti vā? Attānaṃ. Attano vādupādānaṃ attavādupādānaṃ. Attavādamattameva
analyzed: kim vadanti upādiyanti vā attānam attanaḥ vāda upādānam atta vāda upādānam atta vādam attam eva
translated: What do they speak and cling to? To a self. Or the clinging to the view of a self is the view of a self.

original: vā attāti upādiyanti etenāti attavādupādānaṃ. Ayaṃ tāva tesaṃ atthavibhāgo.🔽Dhammasaṅkhepavitthāre pana kāmupādānaṃ tāva “tattha katamaṃ kāmupādānaṃ? Yo kāmesu
analyzed: vā attā iti upādiyanti etena ati attavāt upādānam ayam tāva tesam attha vibhāgo  dhamma saṅkhepa vitthāre pana kāma upādānam tāva tattha katamam kāma upādānam yaḥ kāmesu
translated: They cling by means of this to a self as a mere view of a self, thus it is clinging to the view of a self. This, in the first place, is the analysis of the meaning of these terms.🔽But in the case of the brief and detailed exposition of the states, firstly, sense-desire clinging is said in brief to be the inveteracy of craving, since it is stated thus: “Herein, what is sense-desire clinging?

original: kāmacchando kāmarāgo kāmanandī kāmataṇhā kāmasneho kāmapariḷāho kāmamucchā kāmajjhosānaṃ,
analyzed: kāma chandaḥ kāma rāgaḥ kāma nandī kāma taṇhā kāma snehaḥ kāma pariḷāhaḥ kāma mucchā kāma ajjhosānam
translated: The desire and lust … for the five cords of sense desire …🔽This is called sense-desire clinging” .

original: idaṃ vuccati kāmupādāna”nti āgatattā saṅkhepato taṇhādaḷhattaṃ vuccati. Taṇhādaḷhattaṃ
analyzed: idam vuccati kāma upādānam ti āgata ttā saṅkhepato taṇhā daḷhattam vuccati taṇhā daḷhattam
translated: The inveteracy of craving is said

original: nāma purimataṇhāupanissayapaccayena daḷhasambhūtā uttarataṇhāva. Keci panāhu “appattavisayapatthanā
analyzed: nāma purima taṇhā upanissaya paccayena daḷha sambhūtā uttara taṇhā va keci pana āhu appatta visaya patthanā
translated: But some say that craving is the desire for an object not yet obtained,

original: taṇhā andhakāre corassa hatthappasāraṇaṃ viya, sampattavisayaggahaṇaṃ upādānaṃ tasseva
analyzed: taṇhā andhakāre corassa hattha pasāraṇam viya sampatta visaya ggahaṇam upādānam tassa iva
translated: like the stretching out of a thief’s hand in the dark; and that assuming is the grasping of an object already obtained, like the thief’s grasping of the object.

original: bhaṇḍaggahaṇaṃ viya. Appicchatāsantuṭṭhitāpaṭipakkhā ca te dhammā. Tathā pariyesanārakkhadukkhamūlā”ti.
analyzed: bhaṇḍa ggahaṇam viya appiccha tā asantuṭṭhi tā paṭipakkhā ca te dhammā tathā pariyesanā ārakkha dukkha mūlā ati
translated: And these states are the opposites of fewness of wishes and contentment. And they are the roots of the suffering of searching, guarding, etc.

original: Sesupādānattayaṃ pana saṅkhepato diṭṭhimattameva.
analyzed: pana saṅkhepataḥ diṭṭhimattam eva
translated: The other three assuming are in brief mere views.

original: Vitthārato pana pubbe rūpādīsu vuttaaṭṭhasatappabhedāyapi taṇhāya daḷhabhāvo kāmupādānaṃ.
analyzed: vitthārataḥ pana pubbe rūpa ādīsu vutta aṭṭha sata ppabhedāya api taṇhāya daḷha bhāvaḥ kāma upādānam
translated: But in detail, the strong state of the craving classed in the eighty-one ways according to objects consisting of visible data, etc., is sensual-desire assuming.🔽The wrong view classed in the ten ways according as it has for its object the five beginning with the visible-data base, etc., is virtue-and-duty assuming.

original: Dasavatthukā micchādiṭṭhi diṭṭhupādānaṃ. Yathāha – “tattha katamaṃ diṭṭhupādānaṃ?🔽Natthi dinnaṃ, natthi yiṭṭhaṃ…pe… sacchikatvā pavedentīti yā evarūpā diṭṭhi…pe… vipariyesaggāho.
analyzed: dasa vatthukā micchādiṭṭhi diṭṭhupādānam yathā āha tattha katamam diṭṭhupādānam  na atthi dinnam na atthi sacchikatvā pavedenti iti yā evarūpā vipariyesaggāhaḥ
translated: As it is said: “Herein, what is virtue-and-duty assuming?

original: Idaṃ vuccati diṭṭhupādāna”nti. Sīlabbatehi suddhīti parāmasanaṃ pana sīlabbatupādānaṃ.
analyzed: idam vuccati diṭṭhupādānam ti sīla bbatehi suddhī iti parāmasanam pana sīla bbata upādānam
translated: There is no giving, there is no offering … having found out for himself by his own insight, he explains it to others” , and so on. This is called virtue-and-duty assuming” . And the misapprehending that purification comes about through virtue and observances is rules-and-vows assuming.

original: Yathāha – “tattha katamaṃ sīlabbatupādānaṃ? Sīlena suddhi, vatena suddhi, sīlabbatena🔽suddhīti yā evarūpā diṭṭhi…pe… vipariyesaggāho. Idaṃ vuccati sīlabbatupādāna”nti.🔽Vīsativatthukā sakkāyadiṭṭhi attavādupādānaṃ. Yathāha – “tattha katamaṃ attavādupādānaṃ?
analyzed: yathā āha tattha katamam sīlabbata upādānam sīlena suddhi vatena suddhi sīlabbatena  suddhi iti yā evarūpā vipariyesa ggāhaḥ idam vuccati sīla bbata upādānam ti  vīsati vatthukā sakkāyadiṭṭhi attavād upādānam yathā āha tattha katamam attavād upādānam
translated: As it is said: “Herein, what is adherence to rules and observances? ‘Purity through virtue and observances, purity through austerities, purity through a collection of contrived things, purity through mere virtue and observances, purity through mere austerities, purity through a collection of contrived things, purity through mere virtue and observances and austerities’—🔽whatever view there is of this kind, whatever adherence, whatever inclination, whatever mental slant, whatever mental position, whatever mental fixation, whatever mental fondling, whatever mental relishing, whatever manifestation there is of delight, whatever grasping, this is called adherence to rules and observances” .🔽The twenty kinds of views based on the six bases beginning with the body are adherence to views as a self. As it is said: “Herein, what is adherence to views as a self?🔽

original: Idha assutavā puthujjano…pe… sappurisadhamme avinīto rūpaṃ attato samanupassati…pe…🔽vipariyesaggāho, idaṃ vuccati attavādupādāna”nti. Tattha🔽anamatagge saṃsāre imassa paṭhamaṃ uppattīti abhāvato kilesānaṃ nippariyāyena uppattikkamo🔽na vuccati. Pariyāyena pana yebhuyyena ekasmiṃ bhave attaggāhapubbaṅgamo sassatucchedābhiniveso,
