original: tato “sassato ayaṃ attā”ti gaṇhato attavisuddhatthaṃ sīlabbatupādānaṃ, “ucchijjatī”ti
analyzed: tatas sassataḥ ayam attā ati gaṇhataḥ atta visuddha attham sīlabbata upādānam ucchijjati iti
translated: Then, when he apprehends “This self is eternal,” he clings to virtue and duty for the sake of purifying the self. When he apprehends “It is annihilated,” he clings to a view for the sake of purifying the self.

original: gaṇhato paralokanirapekkhassa kāmupādānanti evaṃ paṭhamaṃ attavādupādānaṃ, tato diṭṭhisīlabbatakāmupādānānīti
analyzed: gaṇhataḥ para loka nirapekkhassa kāma upādānam ti evam paṭhamam attavāda upādānam tatas diṭṭhi sīla bbata kāma upādānāni iti
translated: Then, when he takes it that “This self is eternal,” he clings to virtue and duty for the sake of purifying the self. When he takes it that “It is annihilated,” he is unconcerned about the other world and so he clings to sensual-desire. So firstly there is clinging to a doctrine of self. Then there is clinging to sensual-pleasure, to rites and ceremonies, and to a view.

original: ayametesaṃ ekasmiṃ bhave uppattikkamo.
analyzed: ayam etesam ekasmin bhave uppatti kkamaḥ
translated: This is the order in which they arise in a single becoming.

original: Diṭṭhupādānādīni cettha paṭhamaṃ pahīyanti sotāpattimaggavajjhattā. Kāmupādānaṃ pacchā, arahattamaggavajjhattāti ayametesaṃ pahānakkamo.
analyzed: diṭṭhupādāna ādīni ca ittha paṭhamam pahīyanti sotāpatti magga vajjhattā kāma upādānam pacchā arahatta magga vajjhattā ati ayam etesam pahāna kkamaḥ
translated: But here, firstly, clinging to sensual-pleasure is given up first because it is the object of the path of stream-entry. Clinging to a view is given up last because it is the object of the path of Arahantship. This is the order in which they are given up.

original: Mahāvisayattā pana pākaṭattā ca etesu kāmupādānaṃ paṭhamaṃ desitaṃ. Mahāvisayaṃ hi
analyzed: mahā visaya ttā pana pākaṭa ttā ca etesu kāma upādānam paṭhamam desitam mahā visayam hi
translated: But clinging to sensual-pleasure is taught first among them because it has a great field, and because it is obvious.

original: taṃ aṭṭhacittasampayogā, appavisayāni itarāni catucittasampayogā, yebhuyyena ca ālayarāmattā
analyzed: tam aṭṭha citta sampayogāḥ appa visayāni itarāni catu citta sampayogāḥ yebhuyyena ca
translated: For it is associated with eight kinds of consciousness, while the others are associated with four kinds of consciousness, and it is obvious to people because of their great attachment to it.

original: pajāya pākaṭaṃ kāmupādānaṃ, na itarāni. Kāmupādāna vā kāmānaṃ samadhigamatthaṃ kotūhalamaṅgalādibahulo
analyzed: pākaṭam kāma upādānam vā kāmānam samadhigama attham kotūhala maṅgala ādi bahulaḥ
translated: Or else clinging to sensual-pleasure is taught first because it is the means to sensual pleasures that is the cause of people’s being occupied with divination, omens, etc.,

original: hoti, sāssa diṭṭhīti tadanantaraṃ diṭṭhupādānaṃ, taṃ pabhijjamānaṃ sīlabbataattavādupādānavasena
analyzed: hoti sā assa diṭṭhī iti tad anantaram diṭṭhupādānam tam pabhijjamānam
translated: and that is his view, then the clinging to views comes next. When that is analysed, it is twofold as clinging to rules and vows and clinging to a doctrine of self.

original: duvidhaṃ hoti. Tasmiṃ dvaye gokiriyaṃ kukkurakiriyaṃ vā disvāpi veditabbato oḷārikanti
analyzed: duvidham hoti tasmim dvaye go kiriyam kukkura kiriyam vā disvā api veditabbato oḷārikam ti
translated: Because it can be understood by seeing the behaviour of an ox or a dog, clinging to rules and vows is gross,🔽and because it is subtle, clinging to a doctrine of self is taught last. This is the order of teaching.

original: sīlabbatupādānaṃ paṭhamaṃ desitaṃ. Sukhumattā ante attavādupādānanti ayametesaṃ desanākkamo.
analyzed: sīlabbata upādānam paṭhamam desitam sukhuma tā ante atta vāda upādānam ti ayam etesam desanā kkamaḥ
translated: Herein, craving is a condition🔽For the first in one way only;

original: Taṇhā ca purimassettha, ekadhā hoti paccayo;
analyzed: taṇhā ca purimassa ittha ekadhā hoti paccayo
translated: For the remaining three it is

original: Sattadhā aṭṭhadhā vāpi, hoti sesattayassa sā.🔽Ettha ca evaṃ desite upādānacatukke purimassa kāmupādānassa kāmataṇhā upanissayavasena
analyzed: sattadhā aṭṭhadhā vā api hoti sesa ttayassa sā  ettha ca evam desite upādāna catukke purimassa kāma upādānassa kāma taṇhā upanissaya vasena
translated: In seven or in eight ways.🔽Herein, in the case of the first, that is to say, sense-desire clinging, sense-desire craving is a condition in one way only, as decisive-support condition,

original: ekadhāva paccayo hoti, taṇhābhinanditesu visayesu uppattito. Sesattayassa pana sahajātaaññamaññanissayasampayuttaatthiavigatahetuvasena
analyzed: ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti taṇhā abhinanditesu visayesu uppattito sesa ttayassa pana sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata hetu vasena
translated: because of the arising of the craving for objects that are the objects of delight in craving. But for the remaining three it is a condition in seven ways, as conascence, support, association, presence, non-disappearance, root-cause, and decisive-support conditions,

original: sattadhā vā, upanissayena saha aṭṭhadhā vāpi paccayo hoti. Yadā ca sā upanissayavasena
analyzed: sattadhā vā upanissayena saha aṭṭhadhā vā api paccayaḥ hoti yadā ca sā upanissaya vasena
translated: or in eight ways if proximity is added. And when it is a condition in the way beginning with “as decisive-support”

original: paccayo hoti, tadā asahajātāva hotīti.
analyzed: paccayaḥ hoti tadā asahajātā ava hoti iti
translated: and then it is a condition for them, it is not conascent.🔽This is the detailed explanation of the words “With craving as condition, clinging.”

original: Ayaṃ “taṇhāpaccayā upādāna”nti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.
analyzed: ayam taṇhā paccayā upādānam ti padasmim vitthāra kathā
translated: As to the words “With clinging as condition, becoming,”🔽In the sense, in the ultimate, and in the sense of the ultimate,🔽In the sense of the various kinds and in the sense of the aggregate,

original: Upādānapaccayābhavapadavitthārakathā
analyzed: upādāna paccaya ābhava pada vitthāra kathā
translated: The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,

original: 646. Upādānapaccayā bhavapade –
analyzed: upādāna paccayāḥ bhava pade
translated: The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,

original: Atthato dhammato ceva, sātthato bhedasaṅgahā;
analyzed: atthataḥ dhammato ca iva sā atthataḥ bheda saṅgahā
translated: As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,

original: Yaṃ yassa paccayo ceva, viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: yam yassa paccayaḥ ca iva viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,🔽The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood

original: Tattha bhavatīti bhavo. So kammabhavo upapattibhavo cāti duvidho hoti. Yathāha –
analyzed: tattha bhavati iti bhavo so kamma bhavo upapatti bhavo ca ati duvidhaḥ hoti yathā āha
translated: As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,🔽The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,

original: “bhavo duvidhena atthi kammabhavo, atthi upapattibhavo”ti. Tattha kammameva bhavo
analyzed: bhavaḥ duvidhena atthi kamma bhavaḥ atthi upapatti bhavaḥ ti tattha kammam eva bhavaḥ
translated: As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,🔽The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,

original: kammabhavo, tathā upapattiyeva bhavo upapattibhavo. Ettha ca upapatti bhavatīti bhavo.
analyzed: kamma bhavo tathā upapattiyā iva bhavo upapatti bhavo ettha ca upapatti bhavati iti bhavo
translated: The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,🔽The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,

original: Kammaṃ pana yathā sukhakāraṇattā “sukho buddhānaṃ uppādo”ti vutto, evaṃ bhavakāraṇattā
analyzed: kammam pana yathā sukha kāraṇa ttā sukhaḥ buddhānam uppādaḥ ti vuttaḥ evam bhava kāraṇa ttā
translated: The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,🔽As to the various kinds and as to the aggregate,🔽The kind of becoming that is a condition for what should be understood🔽As to the meaning, as to the ultimate, and as to the ultimate meaning,

original: phalavohārena bhavoti veditabbanti. Evaṃ tāvettha atthato viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: phala vohārena bhavaḥ ti veditabban ti evam tāva ettha atthataḥ viññātabbaḥ vinicchayo
translated: As to the various

original: 647. Dhammato pana kammabhavo tāva saṅkhepato cetanā ceva cetanāsampayuttā ca abhijjhādayo
analyzed: dhammato pana kamma bhavo tāva saṅkhepato cetanā ca iva cetanā sampayuttā ca abhijjhā ādayo
translated: But as to the true nature of things, firstly, kamma-process becoming is, in brief, volition and the states associated with that volition, such as greed, etc.,

original: kammasaṅkhātā dhammā. Yathāha – “tattha katamo kammabhavo? Puññābhisaṅkhāro apuññābhisaṅkhāro
analyzed: kamma saṅkhātāḥ dhammāḥ yathā āha tattha katamaḥ kamma bhavaḥ puñña abhisaṅkhāro apuñña abhisaṅkhāro
translated: which are called kamma. For it is said, “Herein, what is kamma-process becoming? The formation of merit, the formation of demerit,

original: āneñjābhisaṅkhāro parittabhūmako vā mahābhūmako vā, ayaṃ vuccati kammabhavo. Sabbampi
analyzed: āneñja abhisaṅkhāro paritta bhūmakaḥ vā mahā bhūmakaḥ vā ayam vuccati kamma bhavaḥ sabbam pi
translated: the formation of the imperturbable—whether small or great,

original: bhavagāmikammaṃ kammabhavo”ti. Ettha hi puññābhisaṅkhāroti terasa cetanā. Apuññābhisaṅkhāroti
analyzed: bhava gāmi kammam kamma bhavo ti ettha hi puñña abhisaṅkhāro ti terasa cetanāḥ apuñña abhisaṅkhāro ti
translated: all this is called kamma-process becoming” . Herein, the formation of merit is thirteen volitions. The formation of demerit is twelve.🔽The formation of the imperturbable is four volitions. So it is said.

original: dvādasa. Āneñjābhisaṅkhāroti catasso cetanā. Evaṃ parittabhūmako vā mahābhūmako vāti
analyzed: dvādasa āneñja abhisaṅkhāro ti catasso cetanāḥ evam paritta bhūmakaḥ vā mahā bhūmakaḥ vā ati
translated: Whether small or great: by this the weak and strong result of these same volitions is stated.

original: etena tāsaṃyeva cetanānaṃ mandabahuvipākatā vuttā. Sabbampi bhavagāmikammanti iminā🔽pana cetanāsampayuttā abhijjhādayo vuttā.
analyzed: etena tāsam yeva cetanānam manda bahu vipāka tā vuttā sabbam pi bhava gāmi kamman ti iminā  pana cetanā sampayuttāḥ abhijjhā ādayaḥ vuttā
translated: All this is called kamma-process becoming: by this the greed, etc., associated with the volitions are stated.

original: Upapattibhavo pana saṅkhepato kammābhinibbattā khandhā, pabhedato navavidho hoti.
analyzed: upapatti bhavaḥ pana saṅkhepataḥ kamma abhinibbattā khandhā pabhedataḥ navavidhaḥ hoti
translated: Rebirth-process becoming is, in brief, the aggregates generated by the kamma. In detail it is of nine kinds:

original: Yathāha – “tattha katamo upapattibhavo? Kāmabhavo rūpabhavo arūpabhavo saññābhavo
analyzed: yathā āha tattha katamo upapatti bhavaḥ kāma bhavaḥ rūpa bhavaḥ arūpa bhavaḥ saññā bhavaḥ
translated: As it is said: “Herein, what is rebirth-process becoming? Sense-desire becoming, fine-material becoming, immaterial becoming, percipient becoming,

original: asaññābhavo nevasaññānāsaññābhavo, ekavokārabhavo catuvokārabhavo pañcavokārabhavo,
analyzed: asaññā bhavaḥ nevasaññānāsaññābhavo eka vokāra bhavo catu vokāra bhavo pañca vokāra bhavo
translated: As it is said: “Herein, what is rebirth-process becoming? It is the becoming of the sense-desire realm, the becoming of the fine-material realm, the becoming of the immaterial realm, the becoming with perception, the becoming without perception, the becoming with neither perception nor non-perception, the becoming of the single-constituent kind, the becoming of the five-constituent kind.

original: ayaṃ vuccati upapattibhavo”ti. Tattha kāmasaṅkhāto bhavo kāmabhavo. Esa nayo rūpārūpabhavesu.
analyzed: ayam vuccati upapatti bhavaḥ ti tattha kāma saṅkhātaḥ bhavaḥ kāma bhavaḥ esa nayaḥ rūpa arūpa bhavesu
translated: This is called rebirth-process becoming” . Herein, the becoming called “sense desire” is the becoming of the sense-desire realm. So too with the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming.

original: Saññāvataṃ bhavo, saññā vā ettha bhave atthīti saññābhavo. Vipariyāyena asaññābhavo.
analyzed: saññāvatam bhavo saññā va ettha bhave atthi iti saññābhavaḥ vipariyāyena a saññābhavaḥ
translated: The becoming of those with perception is the becoming with perception. Or alternatively, there is perception in this becoming, thus it is the becoming with perception. The opposite kind is the becoming without perception.

original: Oḷārikāya saññāya abhāvā sukhumāya ca bhāvā nevasaññā, nāsaññā asmiṃ bhaveti nevasaññānāsaññābhavo.🔽Ekena rūpakkhandhena vokiṇṇo bhavo ekavokārabhavo. Eko vā vokāro assa bhavassāti
analyzed: oḷārikāya saññāya abhāvā sukhumāya ca bhāvā nevasaññā na asaññā asmin bhaveti nevasaññā nāsaññā bhavaḥ  ekena rūpakkhandhena vokiṇṇaḥ bhavaḥ eka vokāra bhavaḥ ekaḥ vā vokāraḥ assa bhavassa ati
translated: There is neither perception nor non-perception in this becoming, thus it is the becoming with neither perception nor non-perception.

original: ekavokārabhavo. Esa nayo catuvokārapañcavokārabhavesu. Tattha kāmabhavo pañca upādiṇṇakkhandhā.
analyzed: ekavokāra bhavo esa nayo catuvokāra pañcavokāra bhavesu tattha kāma bhavo pañca upādiṇṇa kkhandhā
translated: The becoming that is mixed with one materiality aggregate is the becoming of the single-constituent kind. Or alternatively, it has one constituent, that is, the materiality aggregate, thus it is the becoming of the single-constituent kind. So too with the four-constituent and five-constituent kinds. Herein, the becoming of the sense-desire realm is the five aggregates as objects of clinging.

original: Tathā rūpabhavo. Arūpabhavo cattāro, saññābhavo pañca. Asaññābhavo eko upādiṇṇakkhandho.
analyzed: tathā rūpa bhavaḥ arūpa bhavo cattāro saññā bhavo pañca asaññā bhavo ekaḥ upādiṇṇa kkhandho
translated: So too with the form-process becoming. The formless-process becoming is fourfold. The perception-process becoming is fivefold. The non-perception-process becoming is one, namely, the appropriated aggregate of form.

original: Nevasaññānāsaññābhavo cattāro. Ekavokārabhavādayo ekacatupañcakkhandhā upādiṇṇakkhandhehīti
analyzed: nevasaññā nāsaññā bhavo cattāro eka vokāra bhava ādayaḥ eka catu pañca khandhāḥ upādiṇṇa kkhandhehi iti
translated: So too with the fine-material becoming. The immaterial becoming is four, the percipient becoming is five, the non-percipient becoming is one, the neither-percipient-nor-non-percipient becoming is four. The becoming of the single-constituent kind, etc., is one, four, and five aggregates respectively, as the case may be, since the aggregates are included in the becoming.

original: evamettha dhammatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: evam ettha dhammataḥ pi viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: So here the exposition should be known according to the True Nature.

original: 648. Sātthatoti yathā ca bhavaniddese, tatheva kāmaṃ saṅkhāraniddesepi puññābhisaṅkhārādayova
analyzed: sā atthatā iti yathā ca bhava niddese tathā iva kāmam saṅkhāra niddese pi
translated: As to the meaning: as in the case of the description of becoming, so too in the case of the description of formations, only the formations of merit, etc., are mentioned.

original: vuttā, evaṃ santepi purime atītakammavasena idha paṭisandhiyā paccayattā, ime paccuppannakammavasena🔽āyatiṃ paṭisandhiyā paccayattāti punavacanaṃ sātthakameva, pubbe vā “tattha katamo
analyzed: vuttāḥ evam sante pi purime atīta kamma vasena idha paṭisandhiyā paccayattāḥ ime paccuppanna kamma vasena  āyatim paṭisandhiyā paccaya ttā ti punavacanam sa atthakam eva pubbe vā tattha katamaḥ
translated: But even so, since the former are a condition for rebirth-linking here in this present existence by means of past kamma, and these are a condition for rebirth-linking in the future by means of present kamma, the repetition has a purpose.

original: puññābhisaṅkhāro? Kusalā cetanā kāmāvacarā”ti evamādinā nayena cetanāva saṅkhārāti
analyzed: kusalā cetanā kāma avacarā ati evamādinā nayena
translated: Or alternatively, in the former case “What are the formations of merit? Wholesome intention in the sense-desire element” , and so on, only intention was called “formations” in the way stated.

original: vuttā. Idha pana “sabbampi bhavagāmikamma”nti vacanato cetanāsampayuttāpi. Pubbe
analyzed: vuttāḥ idha pana sabbam pi bhava gāmi kamman ti vacanato cetanā sampayuttā api pubbe
translated: But here, since it is said, “All kamma that leads to becoming” , both intention and what is associated with it are included.

original: ca viññāṇapaccayameva kammaṃ “saṅkhārā”ti vuttaṃ. Idāni asaññābhavanibbattakampi.
analyzed: ca viññāṇa paccayam eva kammam saṅkhārā ti vuttam idāni asaññā bhava nibbattakam pi
translated: and the kamma that is a condition for consciousness is called formations.

original: Kiṃ vā bahunā, “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”ti ettha puññābhisaṅkhārādayova kusalākusalā🔽dhammā vuttā. “Upādānapaccayā bhavo”ti idha pana upapattibhavassāpi saṅgahitattā
analyzed: kim vā bahunā avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā ti ettha puñña abhisaṅkhāra ādayaḥ eva kusala akusalā  dhammā vuttāḥ upādāna paccayāḥ bhavaḥ ti idha pana upapatti bhavassa api saṅgahita ttā
translated: Or what is the use of many words? Herein, in the clause “With ignorance as condition there are formations,” only profitable and unprofitable formations are stated, that is, only the kinds of formations classed as “with root-cause” .🔽But in the clause “With attachment as condition there is clinging,” profitable, unprofitable, and indeterminate states are stated, because rebirth-process becoming is included here.

original: kusalākusalābyākatā dhammā vuttā. Tasmā sabbathāpi sātthakamevidaṃ punavacananti
analyzed: kusala akusala abyākatāḥ dhammāḥ vuttā tasmā sabbathā api sa atthakam eva idam punavacanan ti
translated: So the repetition is meaningful in every way.

original: evamettha sātthatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.🔽649. Bhedasaṅgahāti upādānapaccayā bhavassa bhedato ceva saṅgahato ca. Yañhi kāmupādānapaccayā
analyzed: evam ettha sa atthataḥ pi viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ  bheda saṅgahā ati upādāna paccayā bhavassa bhedato ca iva saṅgahato ca yat hi kāma upādāna paccayā
translated: This is how the exposition should be known here as to meaningfulness.

original: kāmabhavanibbattakaṃ kammaṃ karīyati, so kammabhavo. Tadabhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo.
analyzed: kāma bhava nibbattakam kammam so kamma bhavaḥ tad abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ
translated: As to analysis and synthesis: with attachment as condition there is becoming should be understood as analysis and synthesis. For the kamma that is done with sense-desire attachment as condition is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by that are rebirth-process becoming.

original: Esa nayo rūpārūpabhavesu. Evaṃ kāmupādānapaccayā dve kāmabhavā, tadantogadhā ca saññābhavapañcavokārabhavā,
analyzed: esa nayo rūpa arūpa bhavesu evam kāma upādāna paccayā dve kāma bhavā tad antogadhā ca saññā bhava pañcavokāra bhavā
translated: This is the method in the case of fine-material and immaterial becoming. So with sense-desire attachment as condition there are two kinds of sense-desire becoming, and the kinds of sense-desire becoming classed as percipient and the five kinds of incorporeal becoming are included in that.

original: dve rūpabhavā, tadantogadhā ca saññābhavaasaññābhavaekavokārabhavapañcavokārabhavā,
analyzed: dve rūpa bhavā tad antogadhā ca saññā bhava asaññā bhava ekavokāra bhava pañcavokāra bhavā
translated: Two kinds of sensual-desire becoming, and the percipient and non-percipient kinds of becoming that are included therein, and the single-constituent and five-constituent kinds of becoming,

original: dve arūpabhavā, tadantogadhā ca saññābhavanevasaññānāsaññābhavacatuvokārabhavāti🔽saddhiṃ antogadhehi cha bhavā. Yathā ca kāmupādānapaccayā saddhiṃ antogadhehi cha
analyzed: dve arūpa bhavā tad antogadhā ca saññā bhava nevasaññā na asaññā bhava catuvokāra bhavā ati  saddhim antogadhehi cha bhavāḥ yathā ca kāma upādāna paccayā saddhim antogadhehi cha
translated: two kinds of fine-material becoming, and the percipient and neither-percipient-nor-non-percipient kinds of becoming that are included therein, and the four-constituent kind of becoming,

original: bhavā. Tathā sesupādānapaccayāpīti evaṃ upādānapaccayā bhedato saddhiṃ antogadhehi catuvīsati bhavā.🔽Saṅgahato pana kammabhavaṃ upapattibhavañca ekato katvā kāmupādānapaccayā saddhiṃ
analyzed: bhavā tathā sesa upādāna paccayā api iti evam upādāna paccayāḥ bhedato saddhim antogadhehi catuvīsati bhavā  saṅgahato pana kamma bhavam upapatti bhavam ca ekatas katvā kāma upādāna paccayā saddhiṃ
translated: together with what is included therein, are six kinds of becoming. And as with sensual-desire becoming, so with the remaining kinds of becoming. So with the included kinds there are twenty-four kinds of becoming classed according to cause.🔽But when kamma becoming and rebirth becoming are taken together, then with the included kinds there are twelve kinds of becoming classed according to cause,🔽that is to say, one kind of sensual-desire becoming with what is included therein,

original: antogadhehi eko kāmabhavo. Tathā rūpārūpabhavāti tayo bhavā. Tathā sesupādānapaccayā
analyzed: eko kāma bhavo tathā rūpa arūpa bhavā ti tayaḥ bhavā tathā sesa upādāna paccayā
translated: and likewise one kind of fine-material becoming and one kind of immaterial becoming.

original: pīti. Evaṃ upādānapaccayā saṅgahato saddhiṃ antogadhehi dvādasa bhavā. Apica avisesena
analyzed: pi iti evam upādāna paccayā saṅgahato saddhim antogadhehi dvādasa bhavāḥ api ca avisesena
translated: Moreover, without distinction,

original: upādānapaccayā kāmabhavūpagaṃ kammaṃ kammabhavo. Tadabhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo.
analyzed: upādāna paccayā kāma bhava upagam kammam kamma bhavaḥ tad abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ
translated: kamma that leads to sensual-desire becoming is kamma becoming. The aggregates generated by that are rebirth becoming.

original: Esa nayo rūpārūpabhavesu. Evaṃ upādānapaccayā saddhiṃ antogadhehi dve kāmabhavā,
analyzed: esa nayo rūpa arūpa bhavesu evam upādāna paccayā saddhim antogadhehi dve kāma bhavā
translated: So too in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming. So in this way, with the inclusion of the kinds of becoming that are included in them, there are two kinds of sense-desire becoming,

original: dve rūpabhavā, dve arūpabhavāti aparena pariyāyena saṅgahato cha bhavā. Kammabhavaupapattibhavabhedaṃ
analyzed: dve rūpa bhavā dve arūpa bhavā ati aparena pariyāyena cha bhavā kamma bhava aupapatti bhava bhedam
translated: two kinds of fine-material becoming, and two kinds of immaterial becoming. And in another way there are six kinds of becoming by inclusion of the kinds of becoming that are included in them.

original: vā anupagamma saddhiṃ antogadhehi kāmabhavādivasena tayo bhavā honti. Kāmabhavādibhedampi
analyzed: vā an upagamma saddhim antogadhehi kāma bhava ādi vasena tayaḥ bhavāḥ honti kāma bhava ādi bhedam pi
translated: Or, without making the division into kamma-process becoming and rebirth-process becoming, there are three kinds of becoming, namely, sense-desire becoming, fine-material becoming, and immaterial becoming, with the inclusion of the kinds of becoming that are included in them.

original: anupagamma kammabhavaupapattibhavavasena dve bhavā honti. Kammupapattibhedañcāpi
analyzed: an upagamma kamma bhava aupapatti bhava vasena dve bhavāḥ honti kamma upapatti bhedam ca api
translated: Or, without making the division into sense-desire becoming, etc., there are two kinds of becoming, namely, kamma-process becoming and rebirth-process becoming.

original: anupagamma upādānapaccayā bhavoti bhavavasena ekova bhavo hotīti evamettha upādānapaccayassa
analyzed: upādāna paccayāḥ bhavaḥ ti bhava vasena ekaḥ iva bhavaḥ hoti iti evam ettha upādāna paccayassa
translated: And without making the division into kamma-process becoming and rebirth-process becoming, there is only one kind of becoming, namely, becoming with clinging as condition.

original: bhavassa bhedasaṅgahāpi viññātabbo vinicchayo.🔽650. Yaṃ yassa paccayo cevāti yañcettha upādānaṃ yassa paccayo hoti, tatopi viññātabbo
analyzed: bhavassa bheda saṅgahā api viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ  yam yassa paccayaḥ ca iva ati yat ca ittha upādānam yassa paccayaḥ hoti tatas api viññātabbo
translated: So the exposition should be known here as to kind and as to inclusion in this way.🔽As to what is a condition for what: the meaning is that the exposition should be known as to what kind of clinging is a condition for what kind of becoming.

original: vinicchayoti attho. Kiṃ panettha kassa paccayo hoti? Yaṃkiñci yassa kassaci paccayo
analyzed: vinicchayaḥ ti attho kim pana ittha kassa paccayaḥ hoti yaṃ kiñci yassa kassaci paccayaḥ
translated: But what is a condition for what here? Any kind of clinging is a condition for any kind of becoming.

original: hotiyeva. Ummattako viya hi puthujjano. So idaṃ yuttaṃ idaṃ ayuttanti avicāretvā
analyzed: ummattakaḥ viya hi puthujjanaḥ saḥ idam yuttam idam ayuttam ti a vicāretvā
translated: for the worldling is like a madman. Without examining what is proper and improper,

original: yassa kassaci upādānassa vasena yaṃkiñci bhavaṃ patthetvā yaṃkiñci kammaṃ karotiyeva.
analyzed: yassa kassaci upādānassa vasena yaṃ kiñci bhavam patthetvā yaṃ kiñci kammam
translated: he performs any kind of action whatsoever in order to obtain any kind of becoming whatsoever, by means of any kind of clinging whatsoever.

original: Tasmā yadekacce sīlabbatupādānena rūpārūpabhavā na hontīti vadanti, taṃ na gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā yat ekacce sīlabbata upādānena rūpa arūpa bhavāḥ na honti iti vadanti tam na gahetabbam
translated: Therefore it should not be accepted that the kinds of becoming do not occur through clinging to rules and vows.

original: Sabbena pana sabbo hotīti gahetabbaṃ.
analyzed: sabbena pana sabbaḥ hoti iti gahetabbam
translated: But it should be accepted that all kinds of becoming occur through all kinds of clinging.

original: Seyyathidaṃ – idhekacco anussavavasena vā diṭṭhānusārena vā “kāmā nāmete manussaloke🔽ceva khattiyamahāsālakulādīsu, cha kāmāvacaradevaloke ca samiddhā”ti cintetvā tesaṃ
analyzed: seyyathidam idha ekaccaḥ anussava vasena vā diṭṭha anusārena vā kāmāḥ nāma ete manussa loke  ca iva khattiya mahāsāla kula ādīsu kāmāvacara deva loke ca cintetvā tesam
translated: For example, someone thinks, “These sensual desires are fulfilled for human beings in the human world,

original: adhigamatthaṃ asaddhammassavanādīhi vañcito “iminā kammena kāmā sampajjantī”ti maññamāno
analyzed: adhigama attham asat dhamma ssavana ādīhi vañcitaḥ iminā kammena kāmāḥ sampajjanti iti maññamānaḥ
translated: and for the gods in the six heavenly worlds of the sense sphere,” and he is deceived by listening to false doctrines, etc., thinking, “By this action sensual desires are obtained.”

original: kāmupādānavasena kāyaduccaritādīnipi karoti, so duccaritapāripūriyā apāye upapajjati.
analyzed: kāma upādāna vasena kāya duccarita ādīni pi karoti saḥ duccarita pāripūriyāḥ apāye upapajjati
translated: Through clinging to sensual desires he performs bodily misconduct, etc., and by perfecting misconduct he is reborn in the states of deprivation.

original: Sandiṭṭhike vā pana kāme patthayamāno paṭiladdhe ca gopayamāno kāmupādānavasena kāyaduccaritādīni
analyzed: sandiṭṭhike vā pana kāme patthayamāno paṭiladdhe ca gopayamāno kāma upādāna vasena kāya duccarita ādīni
translated: Or else, longing for sensual pleasures that are visible here and now and guarding those obtained, he commits bodily misconduct, etc., through sensual-desire clinging.

original: karoti, so duccaritapāripūriyā apāye upapajjati. Tatrāssa upapattihetubhūtaṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: karoti saḥ duccarita pāripūriyāḥ apāye upapajjati tatra assa upapatti hetu bhūtam kammam
translated: With the fulfilment of misconduct he is reborn in the states of loss. There his kamma that was the cause of rebirth

original: kammabhavo. Kammābhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo. Saññābhavapañcavokārabhavā pana tadantogadhā eva.
analyzed: kamma bhavaḥ kamma abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ saññā bhava pañcavokāra bhavā pana tad antogadhāḥ eva
translated: is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by the kamma are rebirth-process becoming. But the percipient and the five-constituent kinds of becoming are included in this.

original: Aparo pana saddhammassavanādīhi upabrūhitañāṇo “iminā kammena kāmā sampajjantī”ti🔽maññamāno kāmupādānavasena kāyasucaritādīni karoti. So sucaritapāripūriyā devesu🔽vā manussesu vā upapajjati. Tatrāssa upapattihetubhūtaṃ kammaṃ kammabhavo. Kammābhinibbattā🔽khandhā upapattibhavo. Saññābhavapañcavokārabhavā pana tadantogadhā eva. Iti kāmupādānaṃ
analyzed: aparaḥ pana saddhamma ssavana ādīhi iminā kammena kāmāḥ sampajjanti iti  maññamāno kāma upādāna vasena kāya su carita ādīni karoti so su carita pāripūriyā devesu  vā manussesu vā upapajjati tatra assa upapatti hetu bhūtam kammam kamma bhavaḥ kamma abhinibbattā  khandhāḥ upapatti bhavo saññā bhava pañcavokāra bhavā pana tad anta gadhāḥ eva iti kāma upādānam
translated: Another, with his knowledge enhanced by listening to the true Dhamma, etc., thinking “By this kamma sensual pleasures are obtained,”

original: sappabhedassa sāntogadhassa kāmabhavassa paccayo hoti.
analyzed: sa pabhedassa sa antogadhassa kāma bhavassa paccayaḥ hoti
translated: commits bodily good conduct, etc., through sensual-desire clinging. With the fulfilment of good conduct he is reborn among the gods or among human beings. There his kamma that was the cause of rebirth is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by the kamma are rebirth-process becoming. But the percipient and the five-constituent kinds of becoming are included in this. Thus sensual-desire clinging is a condition for sensual becoming with its subdivisions and its inclusions.

original: Aparo “rūpārūpabhavesu tato samiddhatarā kāmā”ti sutvā parikappetvā vā kāmupādānavaseneva
analyzed: aparaḥ rūpa arūpa bhavesu tatas samiddhatarā kāmā ati sutvā parikappetvā vā kāma upādāna vasena iva
translated: Another, hearing or conjecturing that the sense-desire element is more refined in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming,

original: rūpārūpasamāpattiyo nibbattetvā samāpattibalena rūpārūpabrahmaloke upapajjati. Tatrāssa🔽upapattihetubhūtaṃ kammaṃ kammabhavo. Kammābhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo. Saññā-asaññā-nevasaññānāsaññā-eka-catu-pañcavokārabhavā
analyzed: rūpa arūpa samāpattiyaḥ nibbattetvā samāpatti balena rūpa arūpa brahma loke upapajjati  upapatti hetu bhūtam kammam kamma bhavaḥ kamma abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ saññā asaññā nevasaññā nāsaññā eka catu pañca vokāra bhavā
translated: produces the fine-material and immaterial jhānas by the way of sense-desire clinging, and he is reborn in the fine-material or immaterial Brahmā-world by the power of the jhānas. There

original: pana tadantogadhā eva. Iti kāmupādānaṃ sappabhedānaṃ sāntogadhānaṃ rūpārūpabhavānampi paccayo hoti.🔽Aparo “ayaṃ attā nāma kāmāvacarasampattibhave vā rūpārūpabhavānaṃ vā aññatarasmiṃ
analyzed: pana tad antogadhāḥ eva iti kāma upādānam sa pabhedānam sa antogadhānam rūpa arūpa bhavānam pi paccayaḥ hoti  aparaḥ ayam attā nāma kāmāvacara sampatti bhave vā rūpa arūpa bhavānam vā aññatarasmin
translated: his kamma that was the cause of his rebirth is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by the kamma are rebirth-process becoming. The kinds of becoming classed as percipient, non-percipient, neither-percipient-nor-non-percipient, single-pointed, and five-constituent are included in this. So sense-desire clinging is a condition for the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming with their subdivisions and what is included with them.

original: ucchinne suucchinno hotī”ti ucchedadiṭṭhiṃ upādāya tadupagaṃ kammaṃ karoti, tassa
analyzed: ucchinne su ucchinnaḥ hoti iti uccheda diṭṭhim upādāya tad upagam kammam karoti tassa
translated: Another, having adopted the annihilationist view that “When this self, having been provided with sense desires in a sense-desire-element becoming or in a fine-material or immaterial becoming, is annihilated, it is well annihilated,” performs kamma that is in conformity with that view.

original: taṃ kammaṃ kammabhavo. Kammābhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo. Saññābhavādayo pana
analyzed: tam kammam kamma bhavaḥ kamma abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ saññā bhava ādayaḥ pana
translated: His kamma is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by the kamma are rebirth-process becoming. The kinds of becoming classed as percipient, and so on, are included in this.

original: tadantogadhā eva. Iti diṭṭhupādānaṃ sappabhedānaṃ sāntogadhānaṃ tiṇṇampi kāmarūpārūpabhavānaṃ paccayo hoti.
analyzed: tad antogadhāḥ eva iti diṭṭhupādānam sa pabhedānam sa antogadhānam tiṇṇam pi kāmarūpa arūpa bhavānam paccayaḥ hoti
translated: and the rest are included in that. So the clinging to views is a condition for the three kinds of becoming, namely, sensual-desire, form, and formless, with their several subdivisions.

original: Aparo “ayaṃ attā nāma kāmāvacarasampattibhave vā rūpārūpabhavānaṃ vā aññatarasmiṃ🔽sukhī hoti vigatapariḷāho”ti attavādupādānena tadupagaṃ kammaṃ karoti, tassa taṃ
analyzed: aparaḥ ayam attā nāma kāmāvacara sampatti bhave vā rūpa arūpa bhavānam vā aññatarasmin  sukhī hoti vigata pariḷāhaḥ iti attavāda upādānena tad upagam kammam karoti tassa tam
translated: Another, thinking “This self, after attaining to a happy destiny in the sensual-desire realm or to one of the form or formless kinds of becoming,

original: kammaṃ kammabhavo. Tadabhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo. Saññābhavādayo pana tadantogadhā
analyzed: kammam kamma bhavaḥ tad abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ saññā bhava ādayo pana tad antogadhā
translated: will be happy and free from fever,” performs kamma that leads to that end through the clinging to a doctrine of self. His kamma is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by that are rebirth-process becoming. The rest are included in that.

original: eva. Iti attavādupādānaṃ sappabhedānaṃ sāntogadhānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ bhavānaṃ paccayo hoti.
analyzed: eva iti attavāda upādānam sa pabhedānam sa antogadhānam tiṇṇam bhavānam paccayaḥ hoti
translated: So the clinging to a doctrine of self is a condition for the three kinds of becoming with their several subdivisions.

original: Aparo “idaṃ sīlabbataṃ nāma kāmāvacarasampattibhave vā rūpārūpabhavānaṃ vā aññatarasmiṃ
analyzed: aparaḥ idam sīlabbatam nāma kāmāvacara sampatti bhave vā rūpa arūpa bhavānam vā aññatarasmin
translated: Another, thinking “This virtue and practice, after attaining to a happy destiny in the sensual-desire realm or to one of the form or formless kinds of becoming,

original: paripūrentassa sukhaṃ pāripūriṃ gacchatī”ti sīlabbatupādānavasena tadupagaṃ kammaṃ
analyzed: paripūrentassa sukham pāripūrim gacchati iti sīla bbata upādāna vasena tad upagam kammaṃ
translated: will be fulfilled for one who fulfils it,” performs kamma that leads to that end through the clinging to a rite and ritual as essential.

original: karoti, tassa taṃ kammaṃ kammabhavo. Tadabhinibbattā khandhā upapattibhavo. Saññābhavādayo
analyzed: karoti tassa tam kammam kamma bhavaḥ tad abhinibbattā khandhāḥ upapatti bhavaḥ saññā bhava ādayaḥ
translated: and he does it, then that kamma is kamma-process becoming. The aggregates generated by that are rebirth-process becoming. The kinds of becoming headed by perception are included therein.

original: pana tadantogadhā eva. Iti sīlabbatupādānaṃ sappabhedānaṃ sāntogadhānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ bhavānaṃ🔽paccayo hoti. Evamettha yaṃ yassa paccayo hoti, tatopi viññātabbo vinicchayo.
analyzed: pana tad antogadhāḥ eva iti sīlabbata upādānam sa pabhedānam sa antogadhānam tiṇṇam bhavānam  paccayaḥ hoti evam ettha yam yassa paccayaḥ hoti tatas api viññātabbaḥ vinicchayaḥ
translated: So adherence to rules and vows is a condition for the three kinds of becoming with their divisions and what is included in them.🔽This is how the exposition should be known here as to what is a condition for what.

original: Kiṃ panettha kassa bhavassa kathaṃ paccayo hotīti ce?
analyzed: kim pana ittha kassa bhavassa katham paccayaḥ hoti iti ce
translated: But how is it to be known here as to which kind of becoming is a condition for which kind of becoming?🔽Adherence is a condition

original: Rūpārūpabhavānaṃ, upanissayapaccayo upādānaṃ;
analyzed: rūpa arūpa bhavānam upanissaya paccayaḥ upādānam
translated: For fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming,🔽As decisive support; it should be understood

original: Sahajātādīhipi taṃ, kāmabhavassāti viññeyyaṃ.🔽Rūpārūpabhavānaṃ hi, kāmabhavapariyāpannassa ca kammabhave kusalakammasseva, upapattibhavassa🔽cetaṃ catubbidhampi upādānaṃ upanissayapaccayavasena ekadhāva paccayo hoti. Kāmabhave
analyzed: tam kāma bhavassa ati viññeyyam  rūpa arūpa bhavānam hi kāma bhava pariyāpannassa ca kamma bhave kusala kammassa iva upapatti bhavassa  ca itam catubbidham pi upādānam upanissaya paccaya vasena ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti kāma bhave
translated: That it is a condition for sensual becoming🔽In various ways.🔽For the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming and for the profitable kamma-process becoming in the sensual kind of becoming, this adherence, which is of four kinds, is a condition in one way only, as decisive-support condition.

original: attanā sampayuttākusalakammabhavassa sahajātaaññamaññanissayasampayuttaatthiavigatahetupaccayappabhedehi
analyzed: attanā sampayutta akusala kamma bhavassa sahajāta aññamañña nissaya sampayutta atthi avigata hetu paccaya ppabhedehi
translated: In the sensual kind of becoming it is a condition in various ways for the unprofitable kamma-process becoming that is associated with it, as conascence, mutuality, support, association, presence, non- disappearance, and root conditions.

original: sahajātādīhi paccayo hoti. Vippayuttassa pana upanissayapaccayenevāti.
analyzed: sahajāta ādīhi paccayaḥ hoti vippayuttassa pana upanissaya paccayena eva ati
translated: and it is a condition for the dissociated by way of decisive support condition.

original: Ayaṃ “upādānapaccayā bhavo”ti padasmiṃ vitthārakathā.
analyzed: ayam upādāna paccayā bhavaḥ ti padasmim vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With attachment as condition: continuation.”

original: Bhavapaccayājātiādivitthārakathā
analyzed: bhava paccaya ajāti ādi vitthāra kathā
translated: With continuation as condition: birth, etc.

original: 651. Bhavapaccayā jātītiādīsu jātiādīnaṃ vinicchayo saccaniddese vuttanayeneva veditabbo.
analyzed: bhava paccayā jāti iti ādīsu jāti ādīnam vinicchayaḥ sacca niddese vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ
translated: As regards the clause “With continuation as condition: birth,” etc., the exposition should be understood in the way already stated under the four noble truths.

original: Bhavoti panettha kammabhavova adhippeto. So hi jātiyā paccayo, na upapattibhavo.
analyzed: bhavaḥ ti pana ittha kamma bhavaḥ uva adhippeto so hi jātiyā paccayaḥ na upapatti bhavaḥ
translated: But here “continuation” is intended in the sense of kamma-process continuation. That is a condition for birth, not for rebirth-process continuation.

original: So ca pana kammapaccayaupanissayapaccayavasena dvedhā paccayo hotīti.
analyzed: so ca pana kamma paccaya upanissaya paccaya vasena dvedhā paccayaḥ hoti iti
translated: And that is a condition in two ways, as kamma condition and as decisive-support condition.🔽Here it may be asked: But how is it to be known that continuation is a condition for birth?

original: Tattha siyā – kathaṃ panetaṃ jānitabbaṃ bhavo jātiyā paccayoti ce? Bāhirapaccayasamattepi🔽hīnapaṇītatādivisesadassanato. Bāhirānaṃ hi janakajananīsukkasoṇitāhārādīnaṃ paccayānaṃ
analyzed: tattha siyā katham pana itam jānitabbam bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayaḥ ti ce bāhira paccaya samatte pi  hīna paṇīta tā ādi visesa dassanato bāhirānam hi janaka jananī sukka soṇita āhāra ādīnam paccayānam
translated: Even when external conditions are present,🔽the difference of inferior and superior, etc., is seen.🔽For even when external conditions such as father, mother, blood, semen, etc., are present,

analyzed: samatte pi sattānam yamakānam pi satam hīna paṇīta tā ādi visesaḥ dissati saḥ ca na ahetukaḥ
translated: the difference of inferior and superior, etc., among beings is seen in the case of twins, and so on. And that is not without cause.

original: sabbadā ca sabbesañca abhāvato, na kammabhavato aññahetuko tadabhinibbattakasattānaṃ
analyzed: sabbadā ca sabbesam ca abhāvataḥ na kamma bhavataḥ añña hetukaḥ tad abhinibbattaka sattānam
translated: Because there is no other cause for the generation of beings in the rebirth-process,

original: ajjhattasantāne aññassa kāraṇassa abhāvatoti kammabhavahetukova. Kammaṃ hi sattānaṃ
analyzed: ajjhatta santāne aññassa kāraṇassa abhāvato ti kamma bhava hetukaḥ uva kammam hi sattānam
translated: which is not kamma-process, in their individual existence,

original: hīnapaṇītatādivisesassa hetu. Tenāha bhagavā “kammaṃ satte vibhajati yadidaṃ hīnappaṇītatāyā”ti.
analyzed: hīna paṇīta tā ādi visesassa hetu tena āha bhagavā kammam satte vibhajati yat idam hīna ppaṇīta tāya ati
translated: kamma is the cause of the distinction of beings as high and low. Therefore the Exalted One said: “It is kamma that distinguishes beings as high and low” .

original: Tasmā jānitabbametaṃ “bhavo jātiyā paccayo”ti.
analyzed: tasmā jānitabbam etam bhavaḥ jātiyā paccayaḥ ti
translated: Therefore one should know that “becoming is a condition for birth.”

original: Yasmā ca asati jātiyā jarāmaraṇaṃ nāma, sokādayo vā dhammā na honti. Jātiyā pana
analyzed: yasmā ca asati jātiyā jarā maraṇam nāma soka ādayaḥ vā dhammā na honti jātiyā pana
translated: And because there is no such thing as aging-and-death, or sorrow, etc., without birth,

original: sati jarāmaraṇañceva, jarāmaraṇasaṅkhātadukkhadhammaphuṭṭhassa ca bālajanassa jarāmaraṇābhisambandhā
analyzed: sati jarā maraṇam ca iva jarā maraṇa saṅkhāta dukkha dhamma phuṭṭhassa ca bāla janassa jarā maraṇa abhisambandhā
translated: but when there is birth, there is aging-and-death, and for the fool who is touched by suffering called aging-and-death, there is contact with aging-and-death,

original: vā tena tena dukkhadhammena phuṭṭhassa anabhisambandhā vā sokādayo ca dhammā honti.
analyzed: vā tena tena dukkha dhammena phuṭṭhassa anabhisambandhāḥ vā soka ādayo ca dhammā honti
translated: or else there is sorrow, etc., whether or not he is touched by some other kind of suffering.

original: Tasmā ayampi jāti jarāmaraṇassa ceva sokādīnañca paccayo hotīti veditabbā. Sā pana
analyzed: tasmai ayam pi jāti jarā maraṇassa ca iva soka ādīnam ca paccayaḥ hoti iti veditabbā sā pana
translated: Therefore one should know that birth is a condition for aging-and-death and for sorrow, etc.

original: upanissayakoṭiyā ekadhāva paccayo hotīti.
analyzed: upanissaya koṭiyā ekadhā ava paccayaḥ hoti iti
translated: and as decisive-support condition in one way.

original: Ayaṃ “bhavapaccayā jātī”tiādīsu vitthārakathā.
analyzed: ayam bhava paccayā jāti iti ādīsu vitthāra kathā
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the clause “With becoming as condition, birth.”

original: Bhavacakkakathā🔽652. Yasmā panettha sokādayo avasāne vuttā, tasmā yā sā avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārāti evametassa bhavacakkassa ādimhi vuttā, sā,
analyzed: bhava cakka kathā  yasmā pana ittha soka ādayaḥ avasāne vuttā tasmā yā sā avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā ati evam etassa bhava cakkassa ādimhi vuttā sā
translated: The Wheel of Becoming🔽But since sorrow, etc., are mentioned last, the ignorance that was mentioned first in the clause “With ignorance as condition there are formations” is established

original: Sokādīhi avijjā, siddhā bhavacakkamaviditādimidaṃ;
analyzed: soka ādīhi avijjā siddhā bhava cakkam avidita ādim idam
translated: By sorrow, etc., and this wheel of becoming🔽Has no discoverer, is without a doer, without a feeler,

original: Kārakavedakarahitaṃ, dvādasavidhasuññatāsuññaṃ.
analyzed: kāraka vedaka rahitam dvādasavidha suñña tā asuññam
translated: And void too with a twelvefold voidness.

original: Satataṃ samitaṃ pavattatīti veditabbaṃ.🔽Kathaṃ panettha sokādīhi avijjā siddhā, kathamidaṃ bhavacakkaṃ aviditādi, kathaṃ
analyzed: satatam samitam pavattati iti veditabbam  katham pana ittha soka ādīhi avijjā siddhā katham idam bhava cakkam avidita ādi katham
translated: It should be understood that it goes on revolving continuously and uninterruptedly.

original: kārakavedakarahitaṃ, kathaṃ dvādasavidhasuññatāsuññanti ce? Ettha hi sokadomanassupāyāsā
analyzed: kāraka vedaka rahitam katham dvādasavidha suñña tā suññanti ce ettha hi soka domanassa upāyāsā
translated: But how is ignorance established by sorrow, etc.? How has this wheel of becoming no discoverer, etc.? How is it without a doer and a feeler? And how is it void too with a twelvefold voidness? Herein, sorrow, grief, and despair

original: avijjāya aviyogino, paridevo ca nāma mūḷhassāti tesu tāva siddhesu siddhā hoti avijjā.
analyzed: avijjāya aviyogino paridevaḥ ca nāma mūḷhassa ati tesu tāva siddhesu siddhā hoti avijjā
translated: are inseparable from ignorance, and lamentation is a state of one who is confused. So when these are established, ignorance is established.

original: Apica “āsavasamudayā avijjāsamudayo”ti vuttaṃ. Āsavasamudayā cete sokādayo honti.
analyzed: apica āsava samudayā avijjā samudayo ti vuttam āsava samudayā ca ite soka ādayo honti
translated: Furthermore, it is said: “With the arising of cankers there is the arising of ignorance” . And these griefs, etc., arise with the arising of cankers.

original: Kathaṃ? Vatthukāmaviyoge tāva soko kāmāsavasamudayā hoti. Yathāha –
analyzed: katham vatthu kāma viyoge yathā āha
translated: How? To start with, grief arises with the arising of lust for sensual pleasures, according to the text:

original: “Tassa ce kāmayānassa, chandajātassa jantuno;
analyzed: tassa ce kāmayānassa chanda jātassa jantunaḥ
translated: “When a man is lustful, and lust has taken possession of him,

original: Te kāmā parihāyanti, sallaviddhova ruppatī”ti. ;
analyzed: te kāmā parihāyanti salla viddhaḥ uva ruppati iti
translated: His lust for sensual pleasures destroys him as a flood does the feckless man” .

original: Yathā cāha – “kāmato jāyati soko”ti..
analyzed: yathā ca āha kāmataḥ jāyati
translated: And according to the text: “Sorrow springs from lust” .

original: Sabbepi cete diṭṭhāsavasamudayā honti. Yathāha –
analyzed: sabbe api ca ite diṭṭha āsava samudayāḥ honti yathā āha
translated: And all these arise with the arising of the canker of views, according to the text:

original: “Tassa ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ mama rūpa’nti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyino rūpavipariṇāmaññathābhāvā uppajjanti sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā”ti.
analyzed: tassa aham rūpam mama rūpam ti pariyuṭṭha ṭṭhāyinaḥ rūpa vipariṇāma aññathābhāvāḥ uppajjanti soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsā ati
translated: “When he misapprehends what is not the self as the self, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair arise in him when there is a change in that which is not the self” .

original: Yathā ca diṭṭhāsavasamudayā, evaṃ bhavāsavasamudayāpi. Yathāha –
analyzed: yathā ca diṭṭha āsava samudayā evam bhava āsava samudayā api yathā āha
translated: And as with the canker of views, so also with the canker of desire for becoming, according to the text:

original: “Yepi te devā dīghāyukā vaṇṇavanto sukhabahulā uccesu vimānesu ciraṭṭhitikā, tepi
analyzed: ye api te devāḥ dīgha āyukāḥ vaṇṇavantaḥ sukha bahulāḥ uccesu vimānesu cira ṭṭhitikā te api
translated: “Even those gods whose life-span is long, who are beautiful, blissful, and remain for a long time in lofty mansions,🔽when they hear the Tathāgata’s teaching of the Dhamma, are frightened, terrified, and unnerved” .

original: tathāgatassa dhammadesanaṃ sutvā bhayaṃ santāsaṃ saṃvegamāpajjantī”ti. Pañca pubbanimittāni
analyzed: tathāgatassa dhamma desanam sutvā bhayam santāsam saṃvegam āpajjanti iti pañca pubba nimittāni
translated: The five signs

original: disvā maraṇabhayena santajjitānaṃ devānaṃ viya.
analyzed: disvā maraṇa bhayena devānam
translated: and they are frightened by the fear of death, as the devas were.

original: Yathā ca bhavāsavasamudayā, evaṃ avijjāsavasamudayāpi. Yathāha –
analyzed: yathā ca bhava āsava samudayā evam avijja āsava samudayā api yathā āha
translated: And just as they are due to the arising of the taints of becoming, so too they are due to the arising of the taints of ignorance. For it is said:

original: “Sa kho so, bhikkhave, bālo tividhaṃ diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedetī”ti.
analyzed: sa kho saḥ bhikkhave bālaḥ tividham diṭṭhe iva dhamme dukkham domanassam paṭisaṃvedeti iti
translated: “Bhikkhus, that fool experiences pain and grief here and now in three ways” .

original: Iti yasmā āsavasamudayā ete dhammā honti, tasmā ete sijjhamānā avijjāya hetubhūte
analyzed: iti yasmai āsava samudayāḥ ete dhammāḥ honti tasmai ete sijjhamānāḥ avijjāya hetu bhūte
translated: So since these states are due to the arising of the taints, they are established as the cause of ignorance,

original: āsave sādhenti. Āsavesu ca siddhesu paccayabhāve bhāvato avijjāpi siddhāva hotīti.
analyzed: āsave sādhenti āsavesu ca siddhesu paccaya bhāve bhāvataḥ avijjā api siddhā ava hoti iti
translated: which is the condition for the taints. And when the taints are established, ignorance is established as the condition in the true sense.

original: Evaṃ tāvettha sokādīhi avijjā siddhā hotīti veditabbā.
analyzed: evam tāva ettha soka ādīhi avijjā siddhā hoti iti veditabbā
translated: This, in the first place, is how ignorance should be understood to be established by grief, and so on.

original: Yasmā pana evaṃ paccayabhāve bhāvato avijjāya siddhāya puna avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā,
analyzed: yasmai pana evam paccaya bhāve bhāvataḥ avijjāya siddhāya puna avijjā paccayā saṅkhārā
translated: But when ignorance is thus established as the condition in the true sense, then again formations are conditioned by ignorance,

original: saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇanti evaṃ hetuphalaparamparāya pariyosānaṃ natthi. Tasmā taṃ
analyzed: saṅkhāra paccayā viññāṇan ti evam hetu phala paramparāya pariyosānam na atthi tasmā taṃ
translated: and consciousness by formations, and so on. So there is no end to the succession of causes and effects. Therefore

original: hetuphalasambandhavasena pavattaṃ dvādasaṅgaṃ bhavacakkaṃ aviditādīti siddhaṃ hoti.
analyzed: hetu phala sambandha vasena pavattam dvādasaṅgam bhava cakkam avidita ādi iti siddham hoti
translated: it is established that the twelve-fold dependent origination, which occurs as a succession of causes and effects, is unknown, and so on.

original: Evaṃ sati avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārāti idaṃ ādimattakathanaṃ virujjhatīti ce. Nayidaṃ
analyzed: evam sati avijjā paccayāḥ saṅkhārāḥ idam ādimatta kathanam virujjhati iti ce
translated: If it is so, then the statement that ignorance is a condition for formations is contradicted.

original: ādimattakathanaṃ. Padhānadhammakathanaṃ panetaṃ. Tiṇṇannaṃ hi vaṭṭānaṃ avijjā padhānā.🔽Avijjāggahaṇena hi avasesakilesavaṭṭañca kammādīni ca bālaṃ palibodhenti. Sappasiraggahaṇena🔽sesasappasarīraṃ viya bāhaṃ. Avijjāsamucchede pana kate tehi vimokkho hoti. Sappasiracchede
analyzed: ādimatta kathanam padhāna dhamma kathanam pana itam tiṇṇannam hi vaṭṭānam avijjā padhānā  avijjā ggahaṇena hi kamma ādīni ca bālam palibodhenti sappa sira ggahaṇena  sesa sappa sarīram viya bāham avijjā samucchede pana kate tehi vimokkho hoti sappa sira chede
translated: This is not a statement of the beginning. It is a statement of the principal state. For ignorance is the principal state of the three rounds.🔽For the round of defilements other than ignorance and the round of kamma and so on obstruct the fool, just as the body of the snake obstructs the arm that is seized by the snake’s head.

original: kate palibodhitabāhāvimokkho viya. Yathāha – “avijjāyatveva asesavirāganirodhā saṅkhāranirodho”tiādi.
analyzed: kate palibodhita bāhā vimokkhaḥ yathā āha avid jāyatu eva asesa virāga nirodhā saṅkhāra nirodhā tiādi
translated: But when ignorance is destroyed, he is freed from them, just as the arm is freed from the obstruction of the body of the snake when the snake’s head is cut off. As it is said: “With the remainderless fading away and cessation of ignorance” , etc.

original: Iti yaṃ gaṇhato bandho, muccato ca mokkho hoti, tassa padhānadhammassa kathanamidaṃ,🔽na ādimattakathananti. Evamidaṃ bhavacakkaṃ aviditādīti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: iti yam gaṇhataḥ bandhaḥ muccataḥ ca mokkhaḥ hoti tassa padhāna dhammassa kathanam idam  na ādimatta kathanam ti evam idam bhava cakkam avidita ādi iti veditabbam
translated: So this is a statement of the principal state from which there is bondage for one who grasps it and freedom for one who lets it go.🔽It is not a statement of the beginning.🔽So this round of existence should be understood as “unknown in the beginning.”🔽And since the occurrence of formations, etc., is due to such causes as ignorance, etc.,

original: Tayidaṃ yasmā avijjādīhi kāraṇehi saṅkhārādīnaṃ pavatti, tasmā tato aññena “brahmā
analyzed: tayā idam yasmai avijja ādīhi kāraṇehi saṅkhāra ādīnam pavatti tasmai tatas aññena brahmā
translated: it is not due to any other cause such as Brahmā.

original: mahābrahmā seṭṭho sajitā”ti evaṃ parikappitena brahmādinā vā saṃsārassa kārakena,
analyzed: mahābrahmā seṭṭhaḥ sajitā ti evam parikappitena brahma ādinā vā saṃsārassa kārakena
translated: Or it is devoid of a maker of the round of rebirths, such as Brahmā, etc., conceived of as the best, the creator, the maker, the father of beings, the supreme, the lord, the gen- erator, the transformer, the first, the controller, the wielder of power, the cause, the primal ground, the supreme principle, the supreme Brahman, the supreme person, the supreme deity, the supreme spirit, the supreme reality, the supreme brahman, the supreme soul, the supreme god, the supreme lord, the supreme being, the supreme, the maker, the shaper, the fashioner, the illuminator, the nourisher, the sustainer, the nourisher of the world, the great Brahmā, the best, the creator.

original: “so kho pana me ayaṃ attā vado vedeyyo”ti evaṃ parikappitena attanā vā sukhadukkhānaṃ
analyzed: saḥ kho pana me ayam attā vadaḥ vedeyyaḥ iti evam parikappitena attanā vā sukha dukkhānam
translated: Or it is devoid of a self conceived of as the experiencer of pleasure and pain, as the one who says “Me” and “mine” and “I am,” and as the experiencer.

original: vedakena rahitaṃ. Iti kārakavedakarahitanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: vedakena rahitam iti kāraka vedaka rahitam ti veditabbam
translated: So it should be understood that it is devoid of a maker and an experiencer.

original: Yasmā panettha avijjā udayabbayadhammakattā dhuvabhāvena, saṃkiliṭṭhattā saṃkilesikattā
analyzed: yasmā pana ittha avijjā udaya bbaya dhammaka ttā dhuva bhāvena saṃkiliṭṭha ttā saṃkilesika ttā
translated: But it is void of permanence in the sense that ignorance is subject to arising and falling away; it is void of beauty in the sense that it is defiled and defiling;

original: ca subhabhāvena, udayabbayapaṭipīḷitattā sukhabhāvena, paccayāyattavuttittā vasavattanabhūtena🔽attabhāvena ca suññā. Tathā saṅkhārādīnipi aṅgāni. Yasmā vā avijjā na attā, na attano,
analyzed: ca subha bhāvena udaya bbaya paṭipīḷita ttā sukha bhāvena paccaya āyatta vutti ttā vasavattana bhūtena  atta bhāvena ca suññā tathā saṅkhāra ādīni pi aṅgāni yasmai vā avijjā na attā na attano
translated: it is void of pleasure in the sense that it is afflicted by the suffering of arising and falling away; it is void of self in the sense that it exists in dependence on conditions and is not a self that is independent and wields power.🔽And so too the other factors of the dependent origination.🔽Or it is void in the sense that ignorance is not a self, not a being, not a soul, not a man, not a human, not a person, not a woman, not a man, not neuter, not this, not that, not here, not there, not in between, not all together, not past, not future, not present, not internal, not external, not visible, not invisible, not manifest, not unmanifest, not ceased, not unceased;🔽and so too the other factors of the dependent origination.

original: na attani, na attavatī. Tathā saṅkhārādīnipi aṅgāni. Tasmā dvādasavidhasuññatāsuññametaṃ🔽bhavacakkanti veditabbaṃ.
analyzed: na attani na attavatī tathā saṅkhāra ādīni aṅgāni tasmā dvādasavidha suñña tā suññam etam  bhava cakkam ti veditabbam
translated: So it should be understood that this wheel of becoming is void of twelvefold voidness.

original: 653. Evañca viditvā puna,
analyzed: evam ca viditvā punar
translated: Having understood thus, he should again

original: Tassāvijjātaṇhā, mūlamatītādayo tayo kālā;
analyzed: mūlam atīta ādayaḥ tayo kālā
translated: consider the three times, the root, craving, and the rest.

original: Dve aṭṭha dve eva ca, sarūpato tesu aṅgāni.
analyzed: dve aṭṭha dve eva ca sarūpataḥ tesu aṅgāni
translated: The factors in these are two, eight, two, in their individual essences.

original: Tassa kho panetassa bhavacakkassa avijjā taṇhā cāti dve dhammā mūlanti veditabbā.
analyzed: tassa kho pana itassa bhava cakkassa avijjā taṇhā ca ati dve dhammā mūlanti veditabbā
translated: And of this wheel of becoming, it should be understood that there are two ideas that are its roots, namely ignorance and craving.

original: Tadetaṃ pubbantāharaṇato avijjāmūlaṃ vedanāvasānaṃ, aparantasantānato taṇhāmūlaṃ
analyzed: tat etam pubbanta āharaṇataḥ avijjā mūlam vedanā avasānam aparanta santānataḥ taṇhā mūlam
translated: This wheel is the root of ignorance and ends with feeling because it is drawn out from the past, and it is the root of craving and ends with ageing-and-death because it is drawn out into the future.

original: jarāmaraṇāvasānanti duvidhaṃ hoti. Tattha purimaṃ diṭṭhicaritavasena vuttaṃ, pacchimaṃ
analyzed: jarā maraṇa avasānam ti duvidham hoti tattha purimam diṭṭhi carita vasena vuttam pacchimam
translated: So it is of two kinds. Herein, the first is stated in terms of those of wrong view,

original: taṇhācaritavasena. Diṭṭhicaritānaṃ hi avijjā, taṇhācaritānañca taṇhā saṃsāranāyikā.
analyzed: taṇhā carita vasena diṭṭhi caritānam hi avijjā taṇhā caritānam ca taṇhā saṃsāra nāyikā
translated: and the second in terms of those of craving. For ignorance is the leader of those of wrong view, and craving is the leader of those of craving.

original: Ucchedadiṭṭhisamugghātāya vā paṭhamaṃ, phaluppattiyā hetūnaṃ anupacchedappakāsanato,
analyzed: uccheda diṭṭhi samugghātāya vā paṭhamam phala uppattiyāḥ hetūnam an upaccheda ppakāsanato
translated: Or alternatively, the first is stated for the purpose of removing the view of annihilation, since it shows that there is no cutting off of causes that have given results,

original: sassatadiṭṭhisamugghātāya dutiyaṃ, uppannānaṃ jarāmaraṇappakāsanato. Gabbhaseyyakavasena
analyzed: dutiyam uppannānam jarā maraṇa ppakāsanataḥ gabbhaseyyaka vasena
translated: and the second is stated for the purpose of removing the view of eternalism, since it shows that what has arisen is subject to ageing and death.

original: vā purimaṃ, anupubbapavattidīpanato, opapātikavasena pacchimaṃ, sahuppattidīpanato.
analyzed: vā purimam anupubba pavatti dīpanataḥ opapātika vasena pacchimam sahuppatti dīpanato
translated: Or alternatively, the first is stated in terms of womb-born creatures, since it shows the successive order of arising,🔽and the second in terms of those born by transformation, since it shows the simultaneous order of arising.

original: Atītapaccuppannānāgatā cassa tayo kālā. Tesu pāḷiyaṃ sarūpato āgatavasena “avijjā,
analyzed: atīta paccuppanna anāgatā ca ssa tayo kālā tesu pāḷiyam sarūpataḥ āgata vasena avijjā
translated: And there are three times: past, future, and present. Of these, ignorance,

original: saṅkhārā cā”ti dve aṅgāni atītakālāni. Viññāṇādīni bhavāvasānāni aṭṭha paccuppannakālāni.
analyzed: saṅkhārā ca ati dve aṅgāni atīta kālāni viññāṇa ādīni bhava avasānāni aṭṭha paccuppanna kālāni
translated: And there are three times, past, future, and present. Of these, two factors, ignorance and formations, belong to the past time. The eight beginning with consciousness belong to the present time.

original: Jāti ceva jarāmaraṇañca dve anāgatakālānīti veditabbāni.
analyzed: ca iva jarā maraṇañca dve anāgata kālāni iti veditabbāni
translated: And two, birth and ageing-and-death, should be understood as belonging to the future time.

original: 654. Puna,🔽“Hetuphalahetupubbaka-tisandhicatubhedasaṅgahañcetaṃ;
analyzed: punar  hetu phala hetu pubbaka tisandhi catu bheda saṅgahañca itam
translated: Again,🔽This has three links, four sections, and a twofold order,

original: Vīsati ākārāraṃ, tivaṭṭamanavaṭṭhitaṃ bhamati”.
analyzed: vīsati ākārāram tivaṭṭam anavaṭṭhitam bhamati
translated: With twenty aspects, revolving in three rounds, without beginning or end.

original: Itipi veditabbaṃ.🔽Tattha saṅkhārānañca paṭisandhiviññāṇassa ca antarā eko hetuphalasandhi nāma. Vedanāya
analyzed: iti pi veditabbam  tattha saṅkhārānaṃ ca paṭisandhi viññāṇassa ca antarā ekaḥ hetu phala sandhi nāma vedanāya
translated: It should be understood thus.

original: ca taṇhāya ca antarā eko phalahetusandhi nāma. Bhavassa ca jātiyā ca antarā eko hetuphalasandhīti
analyzed: ca taṇhāya ca antarā ekaḥ phala hetu sandhi nāma bhavassa ca jātiyā ca antarā ekaḥ hetu phala sandhi iti

translated: Herein, in the previous kamma-process becoming: in the previous kamma-process becoming, in the kamma-process becoming in the past birth, is the meaning. original: Paṭiggāhakānaṃ pana hatthe dakkhiṇaṃ patiṭṭhāpayato cetanā bhavoti vuccati. Ekāvajjanesu🔽vā chasu javanesu cetanā āyūhanā saṅkhārā nāma. Sattame bhavo. Yā kāci vā pana cetanā🔽bhavo. analyzed: paṭiggāhakānam pana hatthe dakkhiṇam patiṭṭhāpayato cetanā bhavoti vuccati ekāvajjanesu 🔽vā chasu javanesu cetanā āyūhanā saṅkhārāḥ nāma sattame bhavaḥ yā kāci vā pana cetanā 🔽bhavaḥ sampayuttā āyūhanā saṅkhārāḥ nāma nikanti taṇhā ati yā kammam karontassa phale 🔽upapatti bhave nikāmanā patthanā sā taṇhā nāma upagamanam upādānam ti yam kamma bhavassa
translated: Herein, in the previous kamma-process becoming means in the previous kamma-process becoming, in the kamma-process becoming of the previous birth. The meaning is: when kamma was being done. Delusion is ignorance: the delusion about suffering, etc., that there then was, by means of which he was deluded and did the kamma, that is ignorance. Accumulation is formations: the prior volitions of one who is doing that kamma are called “accumulation” and “formations.” As one who has aroused the thought “I shall give a gift” and who for a month or a year prepares the gift by avoiding sexual activity, using scents and flowers, etc., has prior volitions. But the volition of one who actually places the gift in the recipients’ hands is called “becoming.” Or the six instances of adverting among the impulsions are called “accumulation” and “formations,” and the seventh is called “becoming.” Or any volition whatever is becoming. The associated states are called “accumulation” and “formations.” Attachment is craving: the desire, longing, wish, seeking, for the fruit of the kamma that he is doing in the kamma-process becoming is called “craving.” Grasping is assuming: the assuming of the kamma-process becoming
